Boulevard - gets busy but fairly tame (on weekend nights, they often have one off concerts here - we just so happened to see Robin Thicke and Jason Derulo perform), Marquee - think Mykonos\/Ibiza\/Agia Napa mixed into one crazy day club, you won't know if you're Arthur or Martha and Bamboo - a quiet alternative for those who need to nurse a major hangover (be sure to order the tuna salad - good grief, as fresh as it can get). As others have mentioned, the secret pizza place is by no means the best pizza you'll have eaten but it's certainly worth a visit any time of the day. Do check out Chandelier Bar. This place holds some incredible memories so whenever I am there, I will sit at the ground floor bar and order a Coconut Ciroc on ice - dear lord what I would do to be there right now. I need to get back.

We are so done with this place! We have stayed twice in as many months and we will never return. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, the rooms are amazing, the restaurants are good and Chandelier Bar is lovely. However the customer service leaves a lot to be desired. We stayed 3 nights and our room didn't get cleaned one time, despite 3 phone calls asking for it to be done. We barely got extra towels. The window sill had dead bugs in it, the bathtub wasn't super clean either. Stay at another hotel then go there for the food and bars. We are so disappointed as after our first experience we were assured this one would be better. It wasn't, might have even been worse. We will be staying elsewhere on future trips to Vegas.

I have to say, the Cosmo is probably my favorite casino to just hang out in. They have amazing decor that just makes me feel happy and they always have a good band playing at the Chandelier bar. The gaming here is so so, I don't usually win, but their drinks are fantastic and taste fresher than the drinks at other casinos (read: non neon green sweet and sour syrup) and the drinks are full size which is awesome. The restaurants here are alright, the pizza is good and the buffet is good. I like to go here and just wander around enjoying all of the art and the cool decor. This place is a must visit while in Vegas, and, though I haven't stayed here because it's very pricey, it's in a great location that would be nice to stay in.

Loved our wrap-around corner suite!  It had THE best view of the Strip, and a front row seat to Bellagio water show.  Our one bedroom was very spacious and comfortable.  Both of the bathrooms were luxurious and contained every amenity imaginable.  Our kitchen was fully equipped, and had a very large living room, and a separate dining room area.  Entry had a completely unnecessary foyer.  I mean really, it was bigger than my condo back home.  I would definitely stay here again.
Went to buy pizza @ Cosmopolitan hotel. They closed 20 minutes early. Security threatened me with trespassing. I'll never spend money here again.

I was excited to stay at cosmopolitan but everything was mediocre. For that price? No way. There are plenty of better hotels in Vegas for that price. I was told my room didn't have a nice view so I paid additional $30\/day to get better view and bigger room size. The only thing I liked was the view. 
After grabbing a beer my bf and I wanted to watch a movie before going out to the strip.  But the main TV was not working. I called the front and I was told the repair guy will arrive soon. We waited over 1hr and he didn't come. I was told he is fixing another room. Finally he arrived and said that app or something was not installed. I wonder why they even give people a room that is not ready? We wasted like 2hrs just to get the tv fixed :(
After returning to the hotel, I turned the hot tub water. When I was getting into the hot tub, and there were SEVERAL GUY HAIR and mingled dusts floating on the water. Its definitely not my bf's and it was not mine neither. yuck! 
Next morning, the TV stopped working again.. I didn't call the front again since I didn't wanted to wait and waste another hour.
It was very disappointing that the hotel did nothing about giving me a room with that kind of TV. They definitely knew that it wasn't working properly because they told me I'm not the only one. I've been in numerous hotels and whenever there is some problem, they adjust the room upgrading fee or something since its their fault, but this hotel? they didn't even apologize. They didn't bother. 
On the first night, we went to Marquee night club. The bald chubby guy at the front was very arrogant and rude. He didn't wanted to talk to Asians. I don't know how some ignorant and racist guy like this can be working as a guard.
On the second night, we were all tired so I called the front and asked if I could do little late check-out. The front said rooms are fully booked so they can't give any late check-out. 
Man, it was on the weekday, not even busy weekend.  My check out is 11am and check in is 2pm. Most of the hotels provide at least 12pm check out even if they have another booking that day. But again, they didn't bother.
We went out from our room at 10:50am and the cleaning ladies were already knocking at people's doors and asking if they are ready to go out. 
When I went to do check out, I wanted tell them about the TV and the hair on the hot tub, but the front desk guy didn't even bother to ask me how was my stay.
I know this hotel is kind of busy, but I've never seen that kind of attitude in Vegas hotels.  My room was nearly $300\/day and it was weekdays. For that price, I rather stay Vdara or somewhere else. I'm never going back to Cosmopolitan. 
I hope the head manager will train their staffs again, but again, they probably wouldn't bother to do so.

good bye venetian...HELLO COSMOPOLITAN!!!

wow what an amazing experience. i LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel!

it's so modern and trendy...makes sense i found out a german bank owns this hotel...the staff was so friendly and helpful it was a great experience.

the restaurants in this hotel are also awesome (look for my reviews on the buffet, D.O.C.G., and the pizzeria)

we got the 1 bedroom terrace: had an awesome view, japanese soaking tub with an attached shower, mini kitchen, king sized bed and living room. it's smaller than venetian\/palazzo, but so much more trendy :] the lighting, temperature everything is controlled w\/ the TV remote so cool!!!

there is one thing that was horrible: MARQUEE! omg!!! we were on the 37th floor on the east side tower facing the pool...you can literally hear marquee til 5 AM! it was horrible. the second night we wanted to move rooms, but they didn't have our room so we just asked for ear plugs...GHETTO. i will NEVER stay on that side of the hotel. so if you're a party animal then you'll probably enjoy it...but i came to eat, relax, and gamble :]

speaking of gambling...the tables have decent limits (min: $10-$15) a lot of slots!!! ranging from pennies to hundreds lol. the gambling was amazing! i loved the selection!!!

also there are a lot of bars! the chandelier bar was amazing!!! it was so pretty and elegant...so high class\/trendy! loved it...didn't check out the other bars but definitely will next time. definitely worth your money! check it out you won't be disappointed (but remember EAST SIDE TOWER FACING POOL = LOUD!!!!!!!!)

OH YEA! almost left out the most important thing...at this casino sign up for the identity card even if you don't gamble. every dollar you spend money at (bars, restaurants, shops, rooms anything inside cosmo) you get a point! which means you can get free food, gambling money, even rooms! a good tip! take it...i won't charge you :P

This is my newest favorite hotel on the strip!!! (In all honesty, I've only been to like 5...LOL.) My parents loved their suite here years ago, and I've been to marquee, so I was pretty excited to actually stay here overnight.

Pros:
-dog friendly. Everyone was showering my attention-whore dogs w attn
-Ivan at concierge. I got in extremely late, hangry, and cranky..and he was so understanding and sympathetic of our circumstances and tried to make our stay comfortable. I truly appreciate this, and bc of such small gestures, Cosmopolitan will now be my go-to hotel when I visit Vegas. Also nhan (I think? His manager when we checked in) was super accommodating and helpful. 
-marquee, duh 
-wicked spoon buffet. Pretty decent quality, and reasonable prices during brunch
-the casino doesn't reek of smoke
-soon they will have momofuku milk bar (expected opening 2017), which has my fave cookies ever (compost cookies)
-fast elevators and faster wifi
-spacious and luxurious rooms. Gorgeous views (even tho I didn't have the bellagio view, I thought my view of aria was still nice lol.) 
-overall just really nice amenities 
-service was so friendly by everybody..and special thank you to the awesome valet team who coordinated w a bellhop to get our stuff, the bellhops who dropped off\/retrieved our belongings and put them in the car, and the valet team who retrieved the car. 

Cons:
-I called in to inquire about something and both the people I talked to didn't really know\/have an answer. 
-I always get lost getting to valet pick up. I'm not sure why..but it's clearly not idiot proof

Easily one of the best hotels I've stayed in..Vegas or not.

Durant la soire ou j'tais seul  Vegas , apres le souper j'ai dcid d'aller voir la fin d'un match de hockey. Superbe bar sportif avec les plus grands crans que je n'ai jamais vu. J'ai dcouvert le bonnes bires et rencontr des canadiens qui prenaient aussi pour Ottawa. 
Trs belle soire. :-)

This is a difficult hotel to rate, but I decided to rate it anyway.  I have to say up front that I am not a fan of Vegas, and that is a huge understatement.  I only went to this hotel because it was the conference hotel for a convention that required my attendance.  Many of my concerns could likely apply to other hotels on the strip.  That said, there were several public areas that were smoky.  I found it disheartening that so many of the women who worked in this hotel were dressed in uniforms that lacked modesty.  The guest room itself was impressive, though it is not one to share with someone who you don't want to be naked around.  There are glass doors that serve as a wall between the bedroom and the shower.  Others I was at the conference with described the shower area as like the set for a porn movie.  I don't disagree.  The lighting in the room turns on and off depending upon where you are in the room -- a 'green friendly' feature, but at times annoying.  Still, you can tell the hotel is very new and economical from an energy standpoint, and well constructed.  You have to walk through Casino areas to get to many places where you have to go in the hotel -- not a surprise, but also unpleasant for those of us (like me) who find such areas highly depressing.  One thing that was particularly difficult was finding any food options that were even moderately priced.  Everything anywhere close to this hotel was very, very expensive.  In a later visit to Vegas (again, required by another conference, it was a bad year), I stayed in another hotel that had some more low-moderate cost options.  Overall, I found that the facilities in this hotel were well constructed, staff were certainly attentive, and for what they are selling (an experience focused on the hope of winning money that almost all people won't win and wouldn't even make those who win it very happy anyway) and looking at women who are wearing very little in ways that objectify them, some customers may find some satisfaction.  As for me, I prefer other options.

I have stayed at The Cosmopolitan twice now: once for my bachelorette party and once to just... party. The hotel is in a prime spot of real estate right in the middle of The Strip and all of the action that comes with it. The hotel itself is beautiful, trendy, and modern. The decor includes chandeliers everywhere, crystals draping all over the place, modern pieces of art, etc. 

I have stayed in two different rooms on both sides of The Cosmopolitan, and if you can, I encourage you to get a room that faces the Bellagio fountains\/ Paris Hotel\/ North Strip. The room that I stayed in most recently was a Terrace room on the 46th floor that had a terrace that was probably 30 feet long facing the Bellagio fountains. I challenge you to find another room in Las Vegas with a better view than we had. 

The rooms are clean, well decorated and rather large, compared to other hotels that I have stayed in. In the terrace suite, our room had a full kitchen, dining room, living room, two bathrooms and a large bedroom. It was a nice feature to have a room with two bathrooms, especially given the fact that we had five girls that all had to shower and get ready. I do caution you with the rooms that have full kitchens; Just because it's a full kitchen, that does not mean that it is equipped with all kitchen gadgets and supplies. We learned that the hard way when we attempted to make taquitos at about 4 a.m. and did not have a baking sheet. (Dont' worry, just throw those babies right on the oven rack and they'll cook up nice and crispy.)

Aside from the rooms and the view, another nice thing about staying at The Cosmopolitan was the club, Marquee, was right downstairs. We planned it out so that our last night in town we would go to Marquee, that way we wouldn't have to walk too far to get back to our room, being that as a girl in Vegas, your feet are completely blistered by the last night. Marquee was a lot of fun. It's a nice, open club that has multiple bars open to avoid long lines. They always have pretty good DJs and from what I hear, Marquee is one of the best clubs in Vegas.

Was staying at the Planet Hollywood Towers and the Cosmopolitan is located right across the street.    Went to check it out and fell in love!   What a great feel....retro, classy, sexy, hip, happening, contemporary, luxurious, artsy, energetic vibe!      

Ate at the Overlook Grill (check out my review of this restaurant) and did some gambling.  I was determined to win the Tesla car at the slot machines...unfortunately, I didn't!      

Check out the life-size jacks located near the pool table at the open area of the 4th floor.  Brought back memories of playing jacks as a kid.   (you know the game where you scatter the jacks and take turn to bounce the ball off the ground, then pick up jacks, and then catch the ball before it bounces for a second time).     

When it was time to leave, we didn't feel like walking back to our hotel (too cold outside) so we went to get a taxi.   Check out the life-size retro lamp heater lamps with the pleated shades.    Again...brought back memories to my Mom's old living room lamps.

I left the casino with "Do you know the way to San Jose" in my head....great selection of 60's and 70's classics.

What 60's brain-child came up with the details for this casino?  Love it!

Bear & I were in Vegas for the Magic Fashion Show, Feb 15 - 18. We stayed at the Cosmo which we've wanted to try for a long time  I cannot describe my excitement as we rolled into their driveway. But they left much to be desired. 

We had our reservations + a free upgrade offer that they had emailed us. I mentioned it when I called in to tell them that we're not arriving later & guest services asked if there was anything special we wanted in our room like a tub or something like that & we asked for a stove since we were gonna be there for several days. They said that it could definitely be accommodated based on availability. 

We walked up to the front desk where Mr. NoPersonality  helped us. We showed the printed offer & mentioned the stove & he found us a room with a kitchen, charged the deposit & sent us on our way. When we got to the room, there was no stove. There was a microwave & a sink. The room itself was nice but the view was of some horrible parking structure, but what can you do. We were kind of disappointed but I love eating out so I quickly got over it. 

Later on, I decided to take a bath in their beautiful bathroom which was open to the living room, kinda exciting, BUT when I went to fill the tub, I noticed a black ring around the tub which clearly hadn't been cleaned. I called the front desk, they apologized, but they couldn't move us till the next morning. 

The next day I mentioned the stove again, & they us found us one, but said we had to pay an extra $100 for the remaining nights. I wasn't happy because clearly they had said that with the upgrade offer this would be free, not to mention that they places us in a dirty room, but they didn't even try to make amends, just said sorry about that over and over. We negotiated & brought it down to $50\/night. Our new room was gorgeous & the view was fantastic, the kitchen was complete & the bathtub was clean. 

Later we noticed some issues with our new room as well & thought they weren't bad enough to switch rooms over, they did make me question Cosmos true quality. Is it all empty words for a lot of money, or did we just get the two worst rooms they had to present? There were cleanable stains here & there, we had holes in our sheets, the kitchen didn't have anything in it... I understand they send up clean dishes & utensils when you ask them, but could they keep some dish washing products in the room, or send them up with the dishes so we don't have to call for every bowl & fork which takes 30 mins to arrive forcing us to wash our dishes with shampoo and small towels.  

I can't see myself going back to Cosmo, which is what I said about Vdara, but staying in these rooms where the basics aren't covered, I feel like I owe Vdara an apology. 

------RESTAURANTS

On the 1st night we ordered from Holsteins. Brought the food back to our room & boy was it disappointing. The food was good, but some of the portions were made for a doll house. Our bill came out to $67 which isn't bad but not really appropriate for the amount of food. 

AHI POKE TOSTADA $15 - We thought we would get a decent amount of AHI. But we got two dressing cups of AHI & the "tostada" just happened to be 6 pieces of round Tortilla Chips. 6 pieces only! Pictures will be attached. 

TRUFFLE LOBSTER 'MAC N CHEESE' $16.50 - Not the best Lobster Mac N Cheese I've had but definitely the best dish of the night. Definitely think they could have put more in there but seeing the AHI we also know they could have put way less so lets just be grateful. 

POUTINE $13 - This dish could have won my heart because it had all the right things, but the gravy was dripped on for what I think might have been decorational reasons & overall it felt very dry. 

MILKSHAKES $9 - Chocolate & Malt for Bear & Strawberry for me. Yum! 

------
On the last night, we decided to try one more restaurant in the Hotel, China Poblano. We were under the impression that they had some cool hybrids & we got curious. The place was empty, but they didn't let us in without reservations so we got the food to go. The bill came out to $79, total Waste. 

Open Sesame noodles $9.88 - Went straight into the trash. 

Chicken Ji Song Lettuce Cups  - $16.88 - The only tasty dish, but there were only 4 baby romaine leafs (size of endives).  

Mongolian Beef Lettuce $18.88 - It was bad, like really bad. The beef came in chunks & the lettuce really clashed. Also went into the trash. 

Siu Mai Quail Eggs $16.88 - Yikes. 

------
After getting back to the room and seeing that China Poblano is causing a death wish in us, we went straight to Secret Pizza, ordered a few different ones which were ok, but the THICK WHITE PIZZA was bomb! I must express my appreciation this pizza place because after all the bad food, it kinda felt like flavor was nothing but a dream never to be found again, but Secret Pizza reassured us that flavor is still out there. The next morning we had a great meal at the Aria and got back on the road. Goodbye 4-ever Cosmo!

Stayed at the cosmo when it first opened..... Ahhmazzzing!! Beautiful NO KIDS running around screming soooo beautiful the view if the bellagio water show from our balcony AND bath tub!!

The bamboo pool is my favorite!! Great food good chill music . Get the edimame (you can thank me later ;)) ohhh and the fish tacos!! Can you say yummmmmmmm!!!

Didn't stay here although ate at Comme and played at the Casino. This is by far one of the nicest, cleanest hotels on the strip. We won $70 on penny slots on $5. Lots of games slots and tables. Def will stay there next time in Vegas!
Hippest spot on the strip. H-lights: posh bars with live DJs, people watching, scantily clad eye candy, cheesy foreigner shooting Cristal and the guy with the DEEP Vee

My girlfriend and I placed a bet on the afc winner while on vacation. We came back with her winning ticket and cosmopolitan told us that the sports betting winning ticket needed to be mailed in. Now they are refusing to pay a totally legit winning ticket. What a classless company. They will take your money any way they can but if u have a winning ticket and did not read the fine print on the back they will not pay. Point is if your on vacation don't place a bet on a future payout like Super Bowl or u may get stiffed.

Stay in the Wraparound Suite with the Fountain View! It must be one of the best views on the strip... Seriously! I've stayed in a few of the 5 Star resorts on the strip such as the Palazzo and Wynn and this one is right up there. It isn't huge as the other properties, since it's only on a few acres, but it towers above the rest. Try their buffet, relax in their pool, you won't regret or forget it.  Also, their clubs are the hottest on the strip. The ladies come to grab attention... Can't wait to get back and use my free room offers at the Cosmo!!!

I don't know what the hype is about. I paid a convention rate of $139\/night. If I'd paid the regular room rate, I'd have packed up and left. 

First the good points - all of the staff I came into contact with were very friendly. The decor was interesting - some of it beautiful. Check out and check in procedures were quick and efficient (I checked out via their TV service). 

Bad points - I'll start with the room: it was large and pretty, but it was also rundown. There was a broken lamp fixture in the bathroom, a broken drawer on the desk, and stains on the sofa cushions. The ironing board had holes burned into it, and the melted ironing board cover was stuck on the bottom of the iron. There was a rip in the sheets. There was a dirty dish left in our dishwasher from someone else! Some of the light fixtures did not work. Besides the room, my next complaint would be the restrooms in the convention space and casino. They were not cleaned regularly! The bathrooms near the convention space smelled strongly of sewer gas the first day (thankfully fixed by the next day). I've never been in a hotel that typically charged $300+\/night that had trash all over the bathroom floors! The carpet in the hallway near our room was stained. Another problem was the elevators - there are not enough of them to handle the volume of people trying to use them at certain times of the day (and if you do get an elevator at those times, you quickly find out that they are not air conditioned). 

I did not expect such poor housekeeping and such rundown fixtures as such a new and expensive hotel.

I love Cosmopolitan. we got free comps so we stayed here Tuesday till Thursday. the rooms are so spacious and i love how all the rooms have outdoor balconies. we had an amazing view of the Bellagio water show front. our room included a japanese soaking tub which was super relaxing, definitely a great room if you're with your lover\/husband\/significant other. Theres convenient parking in the garage that is close to the hotel elevators near the East wing of the parking structure. The only negative I would say about the room is that there is no refrigerator, or at least not in the suite we were staying at, only a minibar. I would stay here all the time, but only if we got comps. Otherwise, at $300\/night its way out of my budget. :T
Great view of the strip even when the weather was at 117.  Definitely worth it. Try to get the wrap around balcony. The best!

Our time at the Cosmo was pretty disappointing but keep in mind we're a family of four.  If you're going there to party or gamble, it may be a fine place to stay.

For us the issues started at check-in.  The dual line was over thirty minutes long (I think it actually took over forty-five minutes) and was being managed by line attendants who looked and acted like they were controlling access to some exclusive nightclub instead of a hotel registration desk.  Also a big issue (and this seems to be true of all the hotel\/casino lobbies in Vegas) is that you get a constant wafting of cigarette smoke because the casino floor is on the same level as the lobby.  The hotel registration person said she hated the smell too.  So beware if you have allergies\/breathing issues\/asthma - most, if not all, Vegas casinos are going to be a problem.

Getting up to our room was fine and the room itself seemed to have a veneer of niceness but you could quickly see that things weren't great.  For example of the four sink handles in the bathroom, three turned off at the same point.  One was off by ninety degrees to the others.  When they were all off it just looked bad.  If they don't care about the aesthetics of something like that, what else was wrong?  We found out that first night.

In the middle of the night the closet light came on and would never shut off.  We never figured out why but the next night it didn't turn on.  Given the line in the lobby we never complained and I figured I'd deal with it at checkout.

On our final morning, our neighbors decided it was time for a loud music party early in the morning.  With our kids asleep I called to complain.  Twenty minutes later NO ONE had picked up the phone.  I hung up in disgust with a mind to complain as we checked out.

But if you read above, the same thing that happened at check-in was again in effect.  With a line of well over thirty minutes I gave my keys to a line attendant hoping they would properly check us out (and knowing that AMEX would fix it if they didn't) and we left.

On returning, I emailed their customer service expecting a resolution but instead was told that since they didn't get an opportunity to fix the closet problem they didn't know if it was a real issue.  So apparently I'm lying.  I was also told that during our stay there was no point that a phone wait was 20 minutes.  Again, I can't measure time based on the clock I was staring at.

The only upside of our stay was that we could watch the Bellagio fountain show from our balcony.  Other than that, staying at the Cosmo is a complete bust.

My favorite hotel in Las Vegas right now..it's very modern and cool. I've only stayed once but my stay was nothing short of amazing. Loved every second of the Cosmopolitan. We were fortunate enough to stay in a wrap around terrace suite overlooking the strip. That weekend Lauryn Hill Performed so it was nice watching her perform from balcony.  So when you first walk into suite you walk into long ...long Mirrored Wall hallway ..hidden washer and dryer in one of the closets. How great is that? You get a guest bathroom then it's the full kitchen and dining area. There is a nice living room area with desk and lounge chairs too. The balcony has plenty of seating for you and guests as well. Then in the next room is the master bedroom with huge bathroom that has tub and shower and his and hers sinks...score!   Sliding glass doors in bedroom and main suite area too. Very modern decor and I loved every bit of it, when I have time I will add pics. I loved the toilet room wall paper, lol. 

I called for Spa appointment and staff was way cool and friendly. I got a massage and it was amazing. Spa was nice but Canyon Ranch at the Pallazo is by far my favorite The dealers in the Casino were all pretty great and food at restaurants was good. Loved getting Pizza in the wee early morning to sober up..I forget the name but it's right next to Marquee I think :)

If I could afford it I would stay at this hotel all the time.....I can't think of one thing I don't like. Everything sparkles even their bar... have you seen the Chandelier bar?  I even went to concert in the Chelsea Ballroom (at The Cosmo) recently to watch Adele and I had a great time. Everything went smoothly and ladies.....enough bathrooms for everyone!!!

I love Cosmo. 

Stylish upscale chic. My number one in Vegas. Rooms are great. Penthouses even greater. 

Bars fancy. People beautiful. Service most excellent. 

Marquee day night club. 


Not so much food selections though to eat at the hotel. Also rooms should all have bath tubs. 

Other than that I love cosmo.

Love!!

Wrap around terrace suite is my go to when in Vegas!

In a nut shell:

(These are 2 different occasions)


Checked in at ARIA, left after 24 hrs
Checked in at MGM, left after 24 hrs

Reason being... It wasn't like the COSMO!!! 

I'll never stay anywhere else. Always a pleasure, thank you COSMO!!!

Great hotel for everyone! Due to health, I look at different factors than most people do for what is important in a hotel. Perfect if you have any sort of mobility issue or health problems where you need things to be close and easy to access 

5 stars for :
- Room comfort ( nice thick mattress, comfy pillows, good size bathtub and shower)
- Room proximity to entrance ( if mobility is an issue, they have two towers that are easily accessible. The Chelsea tower is Right by the front entrance where you drop off the car to valet and right by the front desk too, so be sure to request this one. Bonus - if you are able to get this tower you have a chance at having a beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains)
- Balcony - this is so refreshing with big comfy seating and great views, perfect to enjoy early morning or later on when the sun isn't burning down in summer time !
- Easy valet ( coming down from the room to the valet from Chelsea tower is a breeze! You walk out the front entrance, make a right and go immediately down the elevator or escalator and it's right there ! 1\/4 the distance of usual valets 
- Customer service - we had a few issues with room cleanliness and it still being dirty after it was supposedly cleaned again so that is an area that can be fixed, but Alexis in customer care made up for it and then some and that was appreciated! 
- Gambling - Now I never go with the expectation of winning, we just enjoy it, but I much rather play somewhere like here which makes it fun instead of just tanking all your money right away like most will. Maybe we have gotten lucky but haven't ever lost much an always had fun and good drinks ! 
- Restaurant quality- all of the places we tried here are great, especially Zuma which you can see my other review is amazing ! Most restaurants are in the boulevard tower but it is easily accessible if you park in the self parking and find a spot near the boulevard elevators and then pick your restaurant and go up to that level and they are right there!

3 Stars for: 
- Casino chair comfort - they have high chairs that are not really comfortable, especially if you have back issue or other pain factors, I was constantly shifting around and could never get comfy. Though this is pretty common among larger casinos. Mandalay Bay has great chairs that are adjustable up and down!

The Cosmopolitan: It's like the Aria and the Wynn had illegitimate offspring (consequence of a wild night of drunkenness in Vegas), dressed it in Christian Audigier and Ed Hardy, then bedazzled it, added ruffles and accentuated with a plethora of LED lights.

It's stunning to look at. You could and should spend hours just walking around admiring the details. It's multiple levels of extreme architecure and interior design.

We stayed here in the Wraparound Terrace Suite... I've never been in such a large and gorgeously-decorated room! The view from the comfy patio furniture was outstanding. I'd like to live here, please.

I love all of the different-looking and differently-themed bars and lounges around the casino. You don't even have to go out to a club to have a good time if you spend your night at these! The Chandelier is the obvious highlight. I could sit there with a signature drink and enjoy the glimmer for hours!

Of course, The Cosmopolitan hosts the most popular nightclub in Vegas at the moment, Marquee. (See my separate review for details: http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/marquee-nightclub-las-vegas#hrid:bL60s1IxbUnzWpO338EtxQ\/src:self)

They have a good variety of restaurants to enjoy, too. We chose Holstein's by recommendation from Natalia, a bartender at Le Central Bar in Paris. (See my separate review for details: coming soon!)

We checked out the pool area on the top floor (actually multiple pool areas, including the pool area shared by Marquee) - I can't wait until summer to spend some time here! First of all, it's gorgeously designed. The lounge chairs look comfortable and inviting. There is a ton of stadium-style seating. There are lot of bars so no one goes thirsty. ;) When looking out, there is an amazing view of The Strip below.

This new resort and casino on The Strip is amazing... Make sure to stop in or stay here and enjoy all it has to offer.

I have been wanting to stay here for a long time to see what all the fuss is about. Not only has this been the hotel in Vegas that everyone is talking about since it opened but they also run commercials for it constantly and I am easily influenced by brainwashing commercialism. I am glad that I stayed there on a recent trip to Las Vegas with my husband, if only to satisfy my curiosity, but I don't think we will stay there again. I wouldn't rule it out for a bachelorette or b-day party, though. It is more suited to a party weekend with friends than a relaxing getaway for a couple.

The room was really nice. A little more homey and not as luxurious compared to what I was expecting. We were in a one bedroom suite which was very spacious. It had a large "living room" with a couch and a desk and another TV as well as a little kitchen. I really loved the bathroom. It had a nice big shower and a deep soaking tub. The best part of our room was the awesome view directly overlooking the Bellagio fountains. It is pretty rare to get a balcony at a Vegas hotel, never mind one large enough to hold actual patio furniture. We sat out there and watched the water show. It was interesting that there were little vintage chic touches to make the place look old fashioned but yet it was very modern at the same time. It was fun controlling the a\/c and the lights thru the TV the first day or so but that got old fast.

Overall it's a great property, but somehow we just didn't feel comfortable there. It's like the place was designed to make you feel as if only the very trendy, very hip people go there. It is so hyped up that even though it is exciting at first, it becomes obnoxious after a while. We saw people lining up at eight o'clock to get into the club, which opens at ten. So you mean those girls are going to stand around in their micro minis and painfully high shoes for two whole hours?! You couldn't pay me to do that. So that, in a nutshell, is my problem with The Cosmopolitan, they are just trying way too hard to be cool. The sad part is, that it actually is a really cool place when taken in small doses. But put it all together and it is way too much. So what makes this place so cool, you ask? Well, hmm, its hard to explain. Sort of like the matrix, you can not be told, you have to see it for yourself. But here are some of the cool things about this place that I saw or experienced during our stay, in no particular order.

Six foot tall high-heel shoes
Alcoholic milkshakes at the burger joint
Dancing flowers by the front desk
Bar inside of a giant chandelier
Foosball table and big screen tvs outside by the 4th floor pool
Boxing ring in the fitness center
Steampunk miniatures by the 4th floor conference rooms
Pool table in the 3rd floor lobby
Frida Khalo in the Chinese restaurant
Poolside cabanas overlooking the strip
Wall of antique sewing machines
Performance art in a glass room
Foodie gift shop

I was in Vegas two years ago when construction seemed like it was halted on this place. This place make me feel like I've stepped onto the set of Sex and the City -- and I enjoy it. The huge chandelier, the open elevator and the fact that there's plenty of room to lounge, drink and I'm not stuck trying to figure out where the exit is. 

Its clean, modern and beautiful. Supposedly it was supposed to be a high rise living space (hence no casino) but it was bought out when construction was halted and the buyers built a hotel. Its different, very Vegas and I'll definitely be going back.

Great price for a very standard room on the strip. The hotel is very big and offers all types of rooms to accommodate the number of people in your group and your budget.

Amenities for everyone except kids. It isn't a hotel that caters to families (in my opinion) although there are a lot of pools...Las Vegas pools! T&A ALERT.  Would be a great place to hang out poolside in the summer with adult friends for laughs and drinks.

Casino: it was very basic and attracted people of all ages. You know there are some casinos in Vegas that are considered young and hip or for older people. This one falls in the middle. Plenty of slots and tables but not a huge variety like other hotels.

Comedy show, sport betting: comedy show was entertaining. Not a real knee slapped but something fun to do. In the back corner to the right of check in you'll find sport betting and plenty of tvs so you won't miss a game.

We loved the location-we could walk across the street easily from here and take the tram down the strip a little ways (doesn't go all the way down the strip in either direction-unfortunate, I know). Also, this hotel has ample FREE covered parking.

Would I stay here again? Probably not because I'm on a quest to try every hotel on the strip. Should you stay there? Yes, it's worth checking out.

Third stay because of exceptional service from hotel, restaurant, and casino staff in addition to the 'less than over the top - too much glitz' Vibe found at most Vegas hotels. Liberal comped offers help with return trips. Diverse food offerings ranging from top end restaurants to more casual offerings like Egg Slut and Holsteins makes staying on property easy.

Really great hotel! It's swanky and modern. The receptionist gave a free upgrade to the 51st floor with a terrace view. And the view was of the strip and amazing. The room is all about you. My name showed up on the key card and when you turned on the TV. There's a window from the bathroom to the bedroom which can be interesting but there is a blind you can pull down if that bothers you. The showers is huge and amazing. 

They some very cool store - all over priced but fun to walk through and great restaurants - STK, Holsteins. 

Overall a very fun stay.
Hands down the best Hotel you'll ever stay at! Staff here are very friendly and helpful. Stay for yourself and you wont regret!

Zero stars if I could ... New to Cosmo so waited in line (first up) to get Identity Card ... 3 working the counter and they kept taking from the Platinum line which kept growing resulting in me being skipped over 5x - one guy was being "helped" for over 20 minutes!!  Well, we're Diamond and Platinum at other casinos so I guess we won't  be anything at the Cosmo.  Very disappointed in "policy" as well as attitude of counter staff who didn't even acknowledge us at all.

Gorgeous hotel! It houses Marquee Dayclub & Nightclub. I've only been in here to the breathtakingly gorgeous chandelier bar and to the dayclub. These represent two of the most gorgeous venues I went to in Las Vegas. I would love to stay at this hotel the next time I am in Vegas.

Hands down the most fanciest hotel to stay at in Las Vegas!

The location is perfectly located centrally on the strip. Right next to the Bellagio, so at a short walking distance or from your window, you can see the waterfall show .  No matter where your room is located, you will get a good view from any angle of the strip.  The layout of the hotel is not overly huge like the Venetian, therefore, its really easy to navigate.

I stayed in a standard suite, however it is 610 sq. feet, good layout with a ton of space. Two TV's - one above the computer desk\/living room area and the other across from the beds. Large balcony with lounge chairs.  I loved being welcome with Good Morning\/Good Evening messages on the TV and the decor is just simply amazing, very modern and sheik.

Must try's while you are here for good eats are STK and Wicked Spoon.

Be ready to throw down some cash, staying here is one pretty penny, but definitely worth it.

There is nothing bad I can say about this place. I have stayed at the Cosmopolitan the past 2 years when I've come to Vegas and, to me, it is hard to find a hotel as great as this place. 

The room is absolutely amazing. The decor is funky but contemporary. Clean rooms, clean designs throughout the hotel. 

One helpful hint, if you plan on staying at the Cosmopolitan I would recommend you ask for an upgrade to a room with a view overlooking the fountains at the Bellagio...well worth the extra $30 per night. 

Oh and did I mention this is probably the only hotel in Vegas where you have balconies in your room? Amazing to watch the sun set over the strip at night times whilst the fountain spectacular is going off. 

I will definitely be back again.

This is our first stay at the Cosmopolitan and we love it. The staff is terrific and they provide service that comes across as very personal. The view from our room overlooking the Bellagio fountain and the strip is fabulous and we love the balcony. This is just our second day, but so far we are definitely planning future stays here.

Oh cripes.

A little context: I'm not a crazy person with unrealistic expectations.  I know that Vegas is noisy, overpriced, and that The Cosmopolitan is a new hotel so some customer service kinks should be expected.  But this is the worst experience I have ever had - not only in Vegas but at any hotel in the history of the world.

A couple weeks before arrive: I call to book a massage at the spa.  All seems well.  I remember that I should ask for a female therapist and call back 45 minutes later.  THERE IS NO RECORD OF MY SPA RESERVATION?  Huh?  I have to re-book.  Good thing I called back.

We arrive: no one offers to help us with our bags to our room.   Fine, that's okay - no biggie.  We are told that we have to choose between a handicap room with a king-sized bed and a balcony or a standard room that has two beds and no balcony?  Huh?  Okay - we'll take the handicap king-size.  Sadly, this room would be a death trap for a handicapped person as it was nearly impossible to get into the tiny square tub with one very steep, dangerous marble step.

Still - no biggie.  I'm in Vegas!

We were on the 62nd floor right above the Marquee nightclub.  This is a biggie.  I wanted to slit my wrists.  Even that high up, and with ear plugs, the music was SO loud - thumping bass and wailing sirens.  Even with earplugs, we couldn't sleep.  As in, no sleep at all.  And we're not particularly light sleepers.  When we went to complain, we were told that we could not switch rooms until Sunday (we arrived on Friday).  Bad news.  I know you don't go to Vegas to go to bed at 10:00pm, but we couldn't get to sleep until AFTER 4:00am when the music went off.

Overall, the staff is totally aloof.  They make you feel like you are troubling them when you ask for basic things (i.e. - clean towels). Three times in three days, we had to call for clean towels (after our room was cleaned).  Each time it took at least half an hour.  They didn't restock our shampoos, etc. either.  We also had to call down for the Ipod stereo connector (advertised as being in all their rooms) and it took 45 minutes to get to us.  Also took an hour for a corkscrew.  Sigh.  The "sub-zero fridge" advertised on the website is also the bottom half of a mini bar that is an intense freezer.  It froze our beer cans in about 45 minutes, even on the lowest temperature setting.  Even though there is a microwave and "fridge," there is no cutlery or utensils of any kind.

All in all, I felt like a total chump for staying here - that I had been duped by the glitz and glam.  It was a waste of money and a terrible disappointment.  When I spoke to a manager, all he offered me was a $100 food and beverage credit.  How about a refund for a night or two when we couldn't sleep!?  All the time we spent waiting for housekeeping should also be worth at least one night of a refund too.

If you are one of those people who goes to Vegas to wear your trashy Bebe dress and to have an intense 3 day bender where you don't care about clean towels, or sleeping, any kind of customer service, you will love this place.  If not, save yourself and stay somewhere else!

This is based solely on checking out the shops and walking through the casino, being I did not stay here. This ambiance is very nice and they have a club, the marquee, that gets very very busy at night. It looks like it worth checking out. If you are in Vegas this hotel is worth at least walking through.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel Casino is one of my favorite hotels in Vegas. They have  great restaurants, Marquee nightclub and a few fantastic lounges. The crowd is hip and energetic and always looks good. The rooms are great and very comfortable, always clean and I haven't had a problem in one yet. The larger suites on the top floors are especially cool they are bad ass to be honest. If you have the means try one out. For those of you that haven't had a chance to visit The Cosmopolitan you need to get in there, you'll have a great time!

We stayed at the Cosmo this month when we were in Vegas and I was excited as we usually stay with Planet Hollywood.  Cosmo is newer and fresher.

First impression - parking valet was super easy as the check-in lobby was right there when you entered the doors.  It was prime time check-in time (~2:30-3) and it was a breeze. 

We checked in and found out we were nicely upgraded as we needed two queen size beds.  We had a pretty nice room with two decent sized tvs, a small living area with two seats and a sofa, and a sink, microwave, and mini fridge.  Bathroom was nicely oversized with his and hers sinks, shower, soaker tub jacuzzi, and private toilet room.  Also brand named toiletries!!

The cleaners may have rushed cleaning our place as it wasn't PERFECT as I had dreamt.  My cousin, who we were with, has stayed there numerous times before and was looking forward to the slippers they provide and bathrobes.  Neither was available and we had to ask the cleaners that we saw in the hallway.  The locked safe was not working - I think out of batteries or something, and I told the lady who came up and she said she would call a guy.  Well, a guy never came up to fix it so I just forgot about it.  The toilet paper was not a fresh roll either.  A lot of little things that don't really matter but make up the whole experience.  For the price we paid, I'd hoped everything would have already been set up for us.

The hotel casino and space was super nice so I would definitely stay there again.  Great location on the strip as it's smack in the middle of places I frequent.

Overpriced poser-ville. I can't tell you just how much I hate this hotel, and now Vegas in general. That may be the lens I'm seeing this hotel through because Vegas isn't the "Vegas" I remember anymore -at least in my eyes. It's obnoxiously expensive, gaudy, and the clientele here (and everywhere in this town) has become a walking spoof of Kardashian-like self absorbed airheads in ill fitting clothes and garish amounts of tattoos, and that's just the ladies. 

The reservation I made was for a balcony room but was suddenly unavailable once we checked in. Front desk attendant (Melissa) was rude and not accommodating in the least. I would've liked to know prior to my arrival because I would have stayed elsewhere.  Her attitude was too bad, so sad - give me your credit card. 

As far as the hotel goes - hang onto your wallet. Want breakfast for 2? $60+ tip. Lunch? $80+ tip. Dinner? $300 or so and this is even when ordering very modestly. Less than 20 years ago I could find deals galore on food and drinks. Now a round of drinks for two (domestic beer and a low end mixed drink) are $25 with tip. Want to get out to another hotel with your rental car? Many of the hotels now charge by the hour to park. That used to be a freebie to encourage crowds to come to your casino. Now each hotel parking lot is an ATM for them (as if their odds weren't already stacked) I had show tickets down the street at NY NY and they wanted $20 to $30 to let us self or valet park our car during a cirque du soleil show because guess what? T-Mobile arena rented ALL the garage spaces from NY NY. So guys like me get to walk a mile to park just to see the overpriced cirque du soleil show. 

In short - I hate this hotel, the employees, and now I even hate the city itself. So long sin city!  You won't get to gouge me again.

I have found my home away from home when I'm in Vegas. Everything about this place fits my personality like a glove.....except for the damn ugly\/creepy wall paper in the closet. This was my first time staying there and I'm sad to say goodbye to the Venetian\/Palazzo. I can go on and on about this and that but it's best for you to try it out when you're in Vegas.

Painful wait for the check-in, but the rest of the stay was very good. Nice rooms, good service and an incredible fitness center, among the best I've seen anywhere. Great location to be in the middle of the good part of the Strip, would definitely stay here again.

This was a very different Vegas trip for us. No buffets, clubbing or gambling. I was here for the Rock n Roll Half Marathon - which makes it feel more like business! Why? Because you are trying not to get too drunk or too full that you get sick and cannot run the race! This room fit the bill for us. It is right off the finish line and the tub came in handy!

The service compared to the other hotels we've stayed at on the strip is outstanding. They walk up to the queue to walk you to their check-in desk and everything they do is to ensure you have a wonderful stay at the hotel. We had Sue checking us in, we were able to check-in early and get a side view of the Bellagio Water Show. 

We were thinking of getting a bed at the Bamboo pool, but there was a bit of a hiccup in communications regarding that. It didn't bother us much because we realized we can get a better tan in our room on the 55th floor! So much privacy + wraparound terrace = No tan lines ;D

The room was fantastic! Perfect for the two of us. 

The master bathroom had his and her sinks, a huge tube that fits my 6'1 husband (it's not fun for him to sit with his knees out of the water), two bathrooms - so no rushing LOL. 

The kitchen is strange, because it is stocked with nothing to cook with or eat on\/ eat with. But it has a huge fridge and microwave. Please note the sign that says, when you lift up the goodies in the fridge it auto charges. ALWAYS check your account information on the TV, so you do not accumulate silly charges for just looking at the bottle of alcohol. 

Wifi is strong, note that once you are outside on the terrace and close the doors to the balcony your wifi connection gets lost. 

We ordered room service for lunch and then breakfast the next day. Lunch was so-so. The breakfast burrito was not bad! The tortilla seemed like it was freshly made because it was flakey. I ordered pancakes for my pre-race meal!

We spent a whole day lounging on the terrace, watching TV, etc after the race. It was my little oasis. We've been traveling for a couple months and I had not trained enough, so the soreness was everywhere! I needed to vege out in the room! We for sure will come back and do it normal Vegas style.

You gotta help me out
It's all a blur last night
We need a taxi
'Cause you're hung over and I'm broke

Not broke, but with unemployment comes the opportunity to play a little. Quitting my line of work however is harder than leaving the Mob. Partly my fault as I am a bit of a work-a-holic and am doing my best to rid myself of a paycheck (for now).

I'm sure the boss people at The Cosmopolitan have been sitting on pins and needles waiting for me to post my review. I mean 1400 plus postings and mine would surely put this beautiful property over the top.

I've gotten too old for hotels that attract kids running up and down hallways, screaming 20 somethings next door slamming doors and trays of smelling food left outside of rooms. The Cosmopolitan caters towards an older crowd like myself (pushing 40 dude). With this you will encounter spotless halls without any of chaos that other hotels on the strip seem to attract (I'm looking at you Hard Rock...though you aren't on The Strip so umm yeah).

You wanna cash out
And get the hell outta town
Don't be a baby
Remember what you told me

I do remember what you told me and that's why I let you book our hotel. Because of our most recent stay I am now liking Vegas just a little more than I used to. It's not just a place for kids to party. 

In a city that is always about the "next big thing", I would be perfectly fine if from now all my future stays in Vegas are right here.

This has to be the worst Hotel in Nevada.  So I was there for an IT convention on 04\/28\/15 - 05\/01\/15.  When I booked the hotel a few months ago I was really excited to stay there because I was given a great rate on the hotel because of the convention.  We arrived there before noon and checked in but was informed that our room was not available because the cleaning staff was still cleaning the rooms.  We agreed to wait and were given our keys to the room but that the staff would text me when the room was ready and that the keys would then be activated to the room.  There would be no need for us to come back to the check in desk unless there was an issue.  Next we checked in our bags at the bell desk and then proceeded to enjoy the hotels amenities.
So just before 2 PM I got a phone call from one of the staff at the hotel saying that the room I requested was not available but a room on the same floor with 2 Queen Beds was ready to be used.  Since it was just me and my wife I had originally asked for a single King size bed but due to time constraints, the convention started at 2PM and was at another hotel, we took the accommodation.  We figured that we would take the room, call the bell desk to bring up our bags and freshen up then go on our way to the convention a little late.  That was the biggest mistake ever and from then on it just got worse.  My wife went in to use the restroom and there she found a pubic hair on the toilet seat.  She really had to go so I wiped it off and she went.  The rest of what happened there can best be described by the pictures attached.  The room looked like it was cleaned by someone who did not know what they were doing while the whole time using a dirty towel and water.  
Here is a list of problems we found in the supposed clean room:
1. Pubic hair on toilet seat
2. Blood on the inside of the toilet bowl
3. Makeup stains on the walls
4. Smudge stains on the windows and mirrors
5. Mold on the wall
6. Air vents that have not been cleaned in quite a while
7. Seat cushion that had a good layer of dust on them
8. Stains on most of the carpet
9. Tickets and paper on the floor
10. Some crusty stain on one of the duvets
11. A drinking glass that looks like it had been never been cleaned

I called the housekeeping department immediately and the sent up the floor supervisor.  She was a very nice lady and was very sympathetic to our situation.  Once she started to clean she noticed that there were too many issues so she went looking for another room to move us into.  To help keep us informed she promised to be gone 5-10 minutes top.  When all was said and done it took us just under an hour to get to our new room literally 6 doors down and across the hall.  But to be fair to her she did call us a couple of times to let us know that she was cleaning the room for us.  
Once we got to the new room it was cleaner and it finally was the original room I was supposed to get, the one with the King size bed.  So now it is after 3 PM we had not eaten and still needed to get ready to go to the convention.  I was so livid that I called to speak guest services and I was connected to someone from the hotel that I had to explain my concerns before they would even connect me to the proper department.  Once connected I again had to explain what had happened. 
A few minutes later we got a knock at the door with someone delivering a box of chocolates and an apology letter. Now we left the room just after 3:45 having dealt with all of these issues.

We came back to the room that evening being tired from the convention and all of the rushed walking we had to do so that we could make up for the hours we had lost.  So tired we just went to bed.  The next morning while I was down stairs getting my wife some coffee she started to make the bed only to come across what looked like either blood or juice stain on the blanket we had just slept with.  I had gone to the gym and told my wife that when I was done I would try to get that fixed with housekeeping.  

Once I had finished my wife called me to tell me that the shower in our room was not draining so it was like standing in a lake.  Also lights in the room that seem to be working yesterday were not suddenly working now.  I went to the front desk to complain but they were not having it until I produced the pictures that we had taken of the previous room did I get someone from guest services to come out and talk to me.  She said that she would send up someone from the facilities department to address my issue and that she would comp me a visit to the day spa.  But when I looked into what she comped me it was so that I can take a shower there and nothing more.  If I wanted to shower in the open I would have stated in a hostel not a hotel.

Here all they care about is how they can separate you from your money with the least amount of work on their side.

The newest kid on the strip is still the sexiest!

Yup, as soon as you walk into the lobby, you are invited in with the allure of large glass columns with ever changing themes. Chic mirrors and chandeliers dripping with crystals from the ceiling and everything around you just seems to sparkle with a sleek, sexy flare that is all Vegas. 

I checked in for the July 4th weekend and got up sold by a very aggressive front desk clerk that insisted on getting me into the penthouse.  I settled for a 910sq. ft. angle suite on the 58th floor with additional Japanese soaking tub, terrace with a view of the Bellagio fountains, kitchenette with fridge & microwave and an additional full sized bath with shower. Not too shabby.   

The room I must say was very spacious, the view off the expansive terrace was breathtaking and i used the soaking tub practically every night after the clubs so it worked out great!

My only complaint was with housekeeping.  There's a circular red paper note you're supposed to leave on the bed to have your linens changed, which i did but every night i came back to the room, my sheets were done but not changed! It was ridonkulous! Even the dirty pillow that had some sketchy black skid mark smeared on it (that i never used from day one) remained in my room til the last day i was there....nuts!

Perhaps all the smoke and mirrors at the entrance lobby had me blinded by the hotel's sexy charm but with all due respect, my stay was very enjoyable and despite the minor flaws, I had a fantastic time... 

With that said, the hotel was conveniently located in the heart of the strip. It's steps away from the Bellagio, Planet Hollywood and Paris...and the Sahra Spa, brunch and pool were very enjoyable...and partying at the Marquee & Bond was priceless!


Happy Times!

One of the newest additions to the City Center area of the Strip. It's not a huge casino by any means, but they have some pretty AWESOME places to visit inside.

1st and foremost, the roof pool is amazing! I can only imagine this place in the summer. Views overlooking the Strip - like literally you're smack dab in the middle of it - and designed so trendily. Best part of this place.

Also went to the Chandelier Bar here. It was aight. You basically step inside the thing and you get 3 levels of bar. Whatever. Nothing special. I'd rather go to the bar on the other side of the casino called Bond. Significantly cooler and you're able to walk around more freely. 

Lastly, some of the decor of this place looked like it was entrusted to the casino owner's teenage daughter. She just went f'ing crazy and furnished the place from those ear-piercing shops they have at the mall. Fluffy, girly shit everywhere. It will be cool for a few years, but then get incredibly tacky onward. Please hire a new interior decorator.

After being a little day drunk from a Marquee pool party, we went walking around looking for a yummy place to eat. Eventually, my friend and I stumbled on this amazing pizza spot next to Jose Andres' restaurant, which incidentally had actually been recommended to us by another friend though we didn't realize it until later. The pizza was on hit - piping hot, with just enough grease from meaty pepperoni to satisfy my buzzed cravings. Once we sobered up a little, we realized that the Cosmo was gorgeous and had a ton of fine dining to check out, making us realize we want to stay here the next time we are in town. Though we were happy with the Venetian, the Cosmo is sleek and has a great young and modern ambiance that fits in perfectly with those wanting a little sophistication during a weekend of debauchery.

Just spent some time on the casino floor.  Three main things I noticed: 

The service was all over the place.  One bar had lame bartender who had no patience, although she WAS really busy.  One bar had bartenders sitting around who were very nice.  The two bars were about 20 feet from each other and one was packed and one had open seats.  I don't really understand, but okay!  Vegas is a crazy place!

Drinks were expensive which isn't surprising, but at least they were strong (also not surprising - welcome to Vegas).  

The atmosphere and decor were pretty cool.  They were all over the place, from the LED light shows to the giant chandelier, but the common theme was dark, modern, and vaguely club-like.  It was nice, almost felt like being in a club when you're just inside a foyer.  Oh, and the seat I was in at the bar?  Amazingly comfortable.

The rooms are aaaaaamazing!! We booked the one bedroom suite for my birthday weekend and the room are a little pricey, but it was definitely worth it. Our view was right over the bellagio water show, it was like front row tickets without all the rowdiness. Our room had two full bathrooms which came in handy with 4 girls. The annoying part was the kitchenette, it didn't come with any utensils or plates at all. We called in to get some brought up and it took more than an hour! It makes no sense, they should at least ask if you want the brought up during check out. The gadgets in the room are mostly touchscreen, and very new.** Be aware that your room key has your name on it, and you can only go up if you have a key to press the floor on the elevator*** So if your having people over, you will have to come downstairs to bring them up..lame.. The room was still awesome.

I really didn't know what to expect from this place.  Honestly, I thought their commercials were a little creepy and trying too hard.  So I was pleasantly surprised when I first visited the place and explored the different levels.  Ever since that first visit, the Cosmopolitan has kept me coming back for more.

There's a different feel to this place compared to most hotel\/casinos here. I feel like they were targeting my age group (the 20-30-somethings), a younger crowd than the usual Strip population. Whether or not it was on purpose, that is what the Cosmopolitan has become.

The other thing I like about this place: I feel like I can just hang out there.  And I don't feel that way about any other place on the strip.  If I do make my way onto the Strip, it's for a reason (usually eating or shopping).  But the numerous bars always make me consider the Cosmopolitan as a weekend option.

One more reason to love this place: Parking.  Their parking garages are pretty easy to access without having to spend too much time on Las Vegas Blvd. They've also made it easy to find a parking spot with red (occupied) and green (open) lights above each space. And I don't know if it's just my luck, but their valet parking is never full.  Even on a weekend or holiday.  These things are what make this local come back.

Swank, slick and m-a-s-s-i-v-e.  And yet... a total SCENE.

Every hotel that opens in Vegas tries to one-up and out-do the last property that had a grand opening.  The Cosmopolitan is actually a Marriott property, but they downplay that.  Clearly, the goal is to have the Cosmo be known as a unique luxury resort.

It's loud.  You can definitely get disoriented.  I don't think I'd make it in or out alive, by myself.  Even the parking underground is a maze.  Avoiding the gambling areas was a cinch, though.

Hotel rooms, conference space, and ballrooms are divided among different towers.  But the main part of The Cosmopolitan is a vertical shopping structure with eateries, bars and distractions on every level.

The main thing is, tons of people desperate to be noticed come here.  Maybe because the Cosmo is a relatively newer luxury hotel on the Strip-- not just a re-modeled one.  Maybe it has something to do with *untz untz untzz* Marquee being here.

Common areas are maddeningly crowded.  Making it frustrating as far as trying to get from point A to B.  Observing the washed and unwashed masses roaming around the Cosmopolitan is entertaining.

People just stand around blocking escalators, yelling at others in their crew, motor-boating female friends as greeting.  Hen nights.  Circus of randoms dressed and ready to wait in line for an hour just to klurrrb.  Gaggles of wimmens in their most obvious metallic, leather and shiniest, buy me a drank outfits, wobbling around in their seven-inch stilettos.  Hordes of them trying to bounce into Marquee.

Hotel rooms themselves are, thankfully, away from the ridjiculously crowded areas.  Also slightly intimidating, in a weird fashion-- with all the luxe, tech, painfully hip amenities.  Still, it's just a room, people.

Am I sounding not impressed?  Well don't get me wrong, it is an impressive property.  Just a bit overwhelming.

Suffice to say, the Cosmopolitan lives up to its name:  modern, chic... cosmopolitan.

Love this hotel 
But don't like that in the Buffett  restaurant they don't respect handy cup , the lady in the line   Was very rode !!!!!!!

Two stars for the suite. Really nice. However, no washer and dryer, no dish washer, a full kitchen without anything in it. No plate or cup or even a spoon. Had to ask for it and along with everything else, it costs money. One dollar for a spoon!!!  

Don't come and valet and use the bell carts if you have anything other than luggage. $20 charge for anything but luggage. We had wrapped bridesmaid gifts along with a ton of luggage and had to pay $20!!!  

Nickel and dimed for everything, everything costs extra and on top of the room rates, taxes, etc etc, there's a resort fee. For what???  One pool was closed and what other resort amenities do they have?  None!!  And if I'm paying to the gym, they have those at all hotels. Nothing special. 

About day two, we were done tipping, done paying for crap that should have been included because my gawd, there was a stove but if I had wanted a pan, it cost a dollar. Six nights there and again, the room was nice but we will never stay again. Hubby complained and they credited us $200 but that doesn't even cover the few spoons and cups we asked for along with all the detailed costs for every single thing. 

Can you tell I'm probably not choosing The Cosmopolitan again? And why does the hotel lobby smell like sewer all the time?  Terrible to walk into that knowing how much it costs to stay there.

Oh you fancy, huh? 

1 word: Fantastic!!  I am in love with this hotel, its so glamorous and rad. 

the glittery chandeliers all over the place, the different artwork & sculptures, the futuristic touches & the throwback vintage furniture.  it has it all!!  
the restaurants were great, nothing totally out of the ordinary tho, nothing adventurous-food wise.  but good quality food. 

the chelsea is kinda dumb only bc the bathrooms areint in the venue, they are outside of it and a ways away.  so during the black keys shows i had to miss out on a good couple songs bc of the trek to use the loo.  (only reason they get 4 stars) 

other than that, service was good, food was good, decor was fantastic, odds were fantastic.  me gusta!

Fantastic property. Great service and amazing views from this first class property. Best of the best amenities. Two pools overlooking the strip. The Bamboo pool has two bars with service staff to bring food and drinks to you. Great seating with cabanas available for a fee. 

Stayed in a room with two queen beds. Room was fantastic with a view of Bellagio fountains from the 51st floor. Great bath products with large size. Not a skimpy bar of soap by any means. Enough product for multiple people for multiple days. 

Casino is terrific. Clean, vibrant, and smells fresh even though smoking is allowed. They have fragrance machine strategically placed and it works well

$15 black jack tables during off peak. Late night the games range from $25-$100 or more. The place to see and be seen. Highly recommend.
This is my only favorite hotel and casino in Vegas. Some others I like but this one I love love love. From the drinks, rooms, food, vibe, decor, and service. A must stay every time when in Vegas.

I used to love staying at The Cosmopolitan as an invited guest of the casino. Now, it's so overrated and it's so packed with people I will not stay here again. So many issues for a classy hotel, I'm very upset with my recent stay. 

Room Issues: I am paying an expensive resort fee for God knows what. $8 bottles of water in the mini bar is an outrage when they are $2 at the store. It just feels like a rip off here. The TV kept going on and off, on and off. Some sort of sensor was setting on the TV as I was trying to sleep. The pillows were very odd with no support. I pulled a muscle in my neck since I was straining my neck as I slept. The room temperature kept blasting out 40 degree cold air, and then the room would get warm, and then it would be freezing. My spouse and I both ended up shivering in this room and I got sick from the constant room temperature shifts. I was so uncomfortable staying here! 

Room Service: I was charged $40 for a plate of pasta and lemonade. I ordered it without shrimp since I'm vegetarian and they still charged me the price as if I got shrimp. The pasta was very salty and lukewarm. Underwhelming in-room dining experience. 

Dining: I had to wait over AN HOUR of Secret Pizza (not so secret anymore). The guy even forgot my slices so I had to wait another 15 minutes. There are tons of people and lines everywhere! I get it. It's on the Strip. But it's too crazy here now. 

I liked the old Cosmopolitan from maybe 5 years ago much better. Even though it's nicer renovations wise, the service has gone downhill and you are treated in an assembly line. I feel ripped off.

I took my gambling\/table game play elsewhere. They lost my gambling business.

Nice place but our king sized bed sagged in the middle and hurt my back. Then there was only one small trash can for the entire suite. The mini bar\/fridge system was too sensitive and we were charged even though we spoke to three people who said that they wouldn't charge us since we didn't consume anything.
Very nice, clean hotel. The employees were really friendly. I would recommend this hotel for a nice stay in Las Vegas.

I appreciated that the Senior Guest Services Manager reached out to me after I posted a review on my recent stay at the cosmopolitan. She listened and definitely took notes. She even took the time to write an email to apologize for the bad experiences I had during the recent trip and ensure this is communicated to the staff that attended to me. Clearly shows that the cosmopolitan takes their customers' feedback seriously and shows sincerity in redeeming confidence from their customers.
I'm very impressed with how they handled my feedback and also how they tracked down my phone number considering my yelp account is not linked to the cell phone and email account used when checking into the hotel. This shows that the hotel is serious about making their hotel successful and known for impeccable service. With that said, I will give the cosmopolitan another try the next time I'm in Vegas. Great job Guest Services!!

If you want THE Las Vegas experience, go here. 

There's no other way to put it, nothing else to add. It's THE place to be\/go.

Let me just start by saying you know how most reviews ask you if you would recommend this to a friend? Well I would highly recommend the cosmopolitan to anyone!!!!!! 

My boyfriend and I stayed here last weekend for our anniversary and I'm already counting the days when I can come back. From the ambiance to the simple things like pizza, I just couldn't get enough of this place. 

Let's start with check-in, the staff was very friendly and informative. She gave us a map of the place and also recommended going to the Marquee day club, since we were hotel guest we would be comped. 

The room was extravagant! I seriously had to tell myself to close my mouth when I walked into the room. Big, comfy bed with like 8 pillows, your body just sinks in. The tv controller not only controlled the tv but adjusted the lighting, climate and even made reservations for the restaurants in the hotel. The bathroom was unbelievable, so modern and luxurious but yet functional at the same time. 

The food was mouthwatering! We had a slice each at the hidden pizza place our first day and ended up ordering a whole pizza by the end of the first night. We ate at Jaleo for dinner, this place brings the authentic flavor of Spanish tapas and paellas to Vegas. The food was delectable and the service was incredible! We ate at The Henry for breakfast and for a late night sweet tooth fix. The service was also incredible and the food was good for something quick and convenient.

Marquee... Marquee... Marquee! What can I say about this place???? This is one of my favorite clubs in Vegas. We make it a point to come here every time we're in town. This time it was Party Rock Mondays Redfoo from LMFAO, let me just say, if you've never been, you're missing out on one of the best parties in Vegas! Redfoo definitely knows how to entertain! I had the time of my life! 

Now my favorite part of The Cosmopolitan is definitely the pool! The boulevard pool is the most relaxing pool I've ever been to. It has strip views and shallow parts to lay in, so if you get hot from laying out, you can lay out in the pool. I love, love, love this pool!

So needless to say, I highly recommend you stay here at least one but     trust me, you will definitely wanna come back!!!!!!!

I can't stand vegas but this hotel makes it a better experience. Beautiful rooms and if you book thru Marriott (yes) you earn points and upgrade eligibility based on your Marriott status. I've stayed here about 5 times and upgraded every time despite major conferences going on at hotel ( weekdays). Casino is dance, nice chandler bar center stage, everything is reasonable close so your not exhausted walking a vast property. Balcony with great views ( ask to face Bellagio so u can see the water show from your room). Great restaurants..ate at four while there..for a great traveler I'd suggest Eggslut for breakfast and a must find spot on 3rd floor called secret pizza....probably the most affordable best food on the strip. Only complaint my toilet in room was broken I called and it was never serviced so I listened to it run water for days...and left my $50 hot iron in room but now lost and found says it wasn't turned in. My fault but it wasn't turned in.

This was my first time staying at Cosmopolitan. From the moment the valet greeted us to the bellman getting our bags from the car, we felt welcome. 

We got into line at the registration desk and we're greeted by Alain. It was Alain's suggestion that we upgrade from the regular Terrace Studio to the Fountain View -- and he couldn't have been more right! His customer service was, by far, the best that I have ever seen -- hopefully he is promoted really soon! 

We booked the Terrace Studio Fountain View. This room has to be the best room I have stayed in. The bed and pillows were comfortable and relaxing. He bed came with 4 pillows, no need to call down and ask for more. The room had two bathrooms. The first was right as you enter, it had a shower and toilet. The second bathroom has double doors you enter through, there you have a shower, Japanese soaking tub (there's a window at the tub that you can close or keep open and look toward the Bellagio fountains and Paris. 

The patio had phenomenal views of the fountains, Paris, Bally's, the Cromwell and Flamingo. There were two patio chairs as well as ashtrays (if you wish to smoke).

When calling up for our bags, the bellman was at our door In less than 10 minutes. That was the quickest service I have ever got from a bellman at any hotel. Same when we called to have our bags stored before checking out, the bellman was quick and very courteous. 

I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Las Vegas -- whether you're a first timer there or a regular. I most certainly will stay here again.

Great hotel in the middle of the strip just south of Bellagio.  Been here a couple of times and get the terrace one bedroom with the deep Japanese  tub.  These rooms overlook the Bellagio fountain with spectacular view, higher is better and get the west wing of the hotel as the bamboo pool access is your same elevator.  We were on the 59th floor and loved the view.   The bamboo pool is relaxing and don't miss using the
pool and relax.

On check-in they say you'll get a text message when room is assigned.  I never got the message so don't plan on it and check on room if you don't get message by 4pm.  An issue is room cleaning isn't predictable (when or if) and one day we had to call to have room serviced.  Also, be careful to keep a good record of the minibar as I found you can get charged easily by moving around stuff in the fridge and what you had isn't itemized specifically in the bill.

You've got easy access to rest of the strip as there's plenty of food and gambling choices just footsteps away.  We use the RTC (bus) with a stop just outside as it makes it so easy to get to other hotels and sites on the strip.

From when you first walk in the door this hotel is BEAUTIFUL and CHIC! I am from Las Vegas, I have seen the most worn down to the best of the best hotels there and let me tell you the Cosmo is great!
