The dining was good, the decor was beautiful, the chandelier bar is INCREDIBLE, the atmosphere was loud music pumpin through the speakers, beautiful people everywhere almost intimidating,great shopping,very intricate details everywhere. The machines were all state of the art! We ate at Jaleo, they serve tapas. It was excellent! I recommend this hotel completely.
The most amazing suite ever seen.  The lobby is beautiful.. cost of the room is pricey 1500 but once in a lifetime.

Stayed here the first month it opened. Definitely one of the best rooms I have ever stayed in.

Extra large extra modern room with a big flat screen TV and another small one in the bathroom.

Central location, fantastic gym, great view from the balcony.

The Cosmopolitan buffet is the #1 buffet in Vegas.

Love love love this hotel! We got the wrap around terrace suite complimentary and it is pimp status! I love their lobby and the suite is incredible! I would highly recommend this place to be with friends or a sweetheart. The crowd here is young and energetic. Bars everywhere and good shops! Love this place. Best place I stayed at yet in vegas.

Yes,  it was fancy but... the tub was dirty when we got there & i can only imagine... The staff was so fake.  Some people were very nice but def. some very rude employees. When we requested a wake up call they didn't do it.  We called in to ask about it & they said there was no record of it.  The girl was very rude & hung up on us before we finished the conversation.  A guy made us move away from the vip guest lounge before we were able to check in while we were charging our phones.  The only escape from all the smoke was in our room but there was still smoke in the hall way by our room. Room service kept throwing things away i didn't want them to.  
We won this trip & the company who sent us here put a deposit on a room but since the people who were supposed to pay weren't physically there, they wouldn't take payment over the phone and it took over 5hrs! to check in!!! 
Brighter note:  The view from the balcony was just beautiful & the room itself was beautiful

When I'm gambling\/hanging out at the Cosmo, I feel like I actually amounted to something in life. Rest assured, I haven't, but I feel like it. Cosmo gives me hopes and dreams like Disney used to give me as a young padawan. A bunch of MILFs loaded with their old wrinkly hubby's money just hangin' around. I could get used to this lifestyle. Yup, I really think I could. Hmmm....

Love this hotel- decor is beautiful, staff is top notch....drinks are great and the crowd is the Vegas crowd I like...they know how to dress, act and enjoy with out making fools of themselves...my kind of place!

Great hotel!!  We had an incredible time at the Cosmopolitan.  It is in a great location on the strip.  Also, I felt like the smoke was at a minimum which I really liked.  The restaurants we're all good.  We had balcony looking over the strip and being able to walk outside and look down at all the happenings was something you can't really get at any other hotel in vegas.  We had an issue on check out with being charged when it should have gone on our friends ticket, but the staff was great and completely fixed the situation and made everyone happy.  We'll be back in March.

I love this hotel! It is the place to be if you're looking for a good time on the Vegas strip. Check in was super easy, and the woman who helped us at the reservation desk was extremely friendly and helpful. My fianc and I decided to stay for a quick weekend getaway in their standard City Room. The room was very nice, but we've stayed in the Terrace One Bedroom before, and I think we're a bit spoiled from that. If you can, try to upgrade to at least the Terrace One Bedroom! The balcony is a huge plus, and the rooms come with a Japanese soaking tub, which is a selling point for me. 

The casino level can get extremely busy, especially during the weekend, so if you're not one for crowds, you might not want to stay here. BUT, it's a fun hotel, even if you're just walking through.

I really only have one complaint--After checking into our room, my fianc and I decided to lounge around and freshen up. I was in the shower, and my fianc was walking around in a towel about to change her clothes. Someone from housekeeping knocked on our door, and I could hear my fianc yell in front of the door, "one minute, please!" This woman on staff didn't bother to wait and walked right in. My fianc, who was clearly not dressed, asked if she could wait until she put some clothes on. And the woman looked at her and said, "I need to check your mini bar." Instead of waiting, she continues to walk through our room, open up the mini bar door, take a look at the bottles, and walk out without saying anything else. I understand that she was doing her job, and we have no problem with staff members checking things out if they need to, but I'd appreciate a little more courtesy as a guest. I've read a few other reviews on Yelp where other people have complained about staff members entering their rooms unannounced or without permission. I find it odd that it seems to be a trend. Again, I understand that the staff members have to do their jobs, which include entering guests' rooms, but don't be surprised if someone barges into your room while you're standing in a towel.

Perfect view, Marquee day\/night club at the top, right on the strip, whats not to love?? other than the price of course, but hey, its Vegas right?

The rooms are really nice.  We stayed in a suite that had balcony with a beautiful view of the water show next door to the Belagio and a gorgeous view of Vegas itself. The nice thing also is you walk outside and across the street is Planet Hollywood with their inside mall!. Close by to everything from other hotels, restaurants to clubs.

The room was very spacious.  I've had bad  experiences with hotel beds and pillows, even at the Vegas hotels. I feel like the pillows sometimes are too soft, or too elevated for me where I wake up with my neck all stiff. Normally the beds are too soft that you sink in them, how are you suppose to get busy with a woman if you can't keep yourself balanced or from sinking in?? Any who, I didn't have a problem with that at the Cosmopolitan.  I actually managed to get some rest to continue the partying the following night.  What I really loved from our suite, was the bathroom.  The bathtub had its own jets built-in that made it into a personal, one seat er jacuzzi.  I sat my ass in that bathtub for about an hour, dying from my hangover.  Surprisingly, it help!

Service was excellent, the price is a little steep, but totally worth the experience.  If your a "weekend warrior" that likes to go to Vegas often, try the Cosmopolitan at least once, pretty sure you'll like it.  Make sure you get a room on the side of the building that gets that water show from the Belagio!
Gorgeous hotel with a fabulous selection of restaurants. I haven't stayed here yet but I would b\/c it's one of those fancy hotels I like.

This is one of those "I don't really get all the positive reviews" kinds of reviews. 

This hotel is pretty and shiny and newish, but little cheesy\/eighties with the red and the black and the glittery bits. The entire property is basically one big nightclub with beds. I know you come across some degree of this in every Vegas property with a casino; but, this was to the nth degree of anything I have experienced in a long history of successful gambling\/bing drinking\/gourgingtrips to the city. 

We had called and requested a certain room type days in advance, then again called to confirm that morning of travel and were assured it would not be a problem. But, upon check-in, were advised the room was not available. The room we were placed in was fine, but situated directly above the indoor\/outdoor nightclub. You don't really sleep that much in Vegas anyway, but at 14 floors above the lounge I really wouldn't expect the party to be penetrating my walls from 6am to 4am. Don't most people stay in bed past at least 9am in Viva anyway?

The second night the hotel did move us, as requested, to the quieter side of the building, overlooking the Bellagio fountains. If I had some way to pipe the music up from the fountains to my room, I probably would have spent the whole weekend on the balcony. One very nice thing about the rooms was the access to a decent sized patio, which is hard to find anywhere in Las Vegas. 

Our second room was as attractive as the bellman that moved us into it. The rooms are contemporary, in a 'this was chic in 1985 is cool again white on white kind of way'. The rooms had two well defined areas, one for sleeping and one for lounging, as well as a nice sized bathroom with Bigelow amenities. I liked the fact that each room had lots of art and culture related books, although, one of the big picture books was sticky. Hotel+Vegas+Sticky Picture Book = Idontwannaknow. 

The bottom line for me is that I am not now, nor have I ever been a club girl. The Cosmopolitan is made for the club guys and girls of the world. And, with the $350 price tag on a holiday weekend, your average club guys and girls were packing themselves like sardines in to their double occupancy rooms so they could still afford their Red Bull & vodka cocktails. On several occasions we had to wait times to get up and down the elevators because they were so overly full. The civil engineer who approved that design should stick to single floor establishments. 

The hotel was absolutely overrun with hammered broads in cheap heels and cheaper dresses (I know guys - dream come true) and douchey dudes in stripey shirts. I walked outside one night to a waiting car, on our way out to a nice dinner, and stepped directly into gum, which essentially ruined my (not cheap) shoes. I could go on for days, but I think "gum spitting crowd" and a staff who doesn't care to clean it up pretty much sums up my experience here.

It is one of the few hotels that has rooms with a balcony. I would suggest get a room facing the Bellagio fountain for a nice view and great pictures at night when the fountains start playing (the picture I took was around the 40th floors. Just walking through the Cosmopolitan, you would think that you were in a fancy mall. There are tons of shops and restaurants here that you could probably spend the first couple of days here and be okay with it. The Marquee Club is one of the best clubs in Las Vegas and worth checking out.

Had a great time staying here right after I got married but when I went to my room to check in I entered in a room with people already in it which has never happened to me before. The hotel really booked me in a suite that already had customers still in it. I specifically booked that suite to enjoy a pre honeymoon weekend with my husband. They ended up changing our room to another suite (not the same one as booked) which was ok but I still wanted to be booked in the room with the jacuzzi. The hotel is beautiful and the food was good so I think they just need a better check in system because it took them FOREVER to figure out the situation once we told them the room they gave us was already occupied. Shouldn't take 30 minutes to decide what to do.

I've never stayed at the Cosmopolitan (I'm not fancy enough :(...) but I love the way it's decorated! It's very chic and modern and I've had great experiences with the staff while gambling there...well if you call $10 blackjack gambling. I'm not fancy, remember?

I'd love to stay here on one of my visits. Out of all the hotels on the strip, this one was the most memorable.

This past October was our second trip to The Cosmo & my husband is a Platinum Elite member. Last time we came, we received an upgrade to a very large suite but this time we were told it would cost $150 extra a night if we wanted the upgrade this time. This didn't make sense to me because the room was obviously available and they didn't charge us last time we requested an upgrade. Apparently they don't offer this perk for Platinum Elite anymore, but oh well. VIP Check-in is worth it so you don't have to wait in long lines. We received a room with a good fountain view, though smaller than I'd hoped for. Terrace Suite was good, clean, and comfortable. They do still offer the Wicked Spoon brunch buffet for two for Platinum, but the drinks are no longer included as they once were. Still, $10 dollar bottomless mimosas or bloody mary's...not too bad!

For the gamblers: The dealers here are very friendly - as the security guards are too. I can't tell you how many times I got carded and they asked in an INCREDIBLY polite way. My ID was never demanded, always asked politely if they could please see it. I shouldn't complain for getting carded, but when you hear it 15 times in an hour, you want to hear somebody be polite about it.

The Bad:

-This entire casino smells like sewage. Am I the only person who thinks this? I'm not sure if it's a combo of the perfumes and central air scent or what, but it's weird.

-Service has depleted a bit since our last visit a year ago.

Honestly, I'll keep coming back here since we don't have to pay anything, but had we paid, i would have expected higher service levels than we received this time.

Cosmopolitan is a price gouge room was suppose to be 786.00 for the time we stayed there. After all said and done it was close to a grand. They then decided to charge me after we checked out on my credit card. I would suggest going elsewhere.

Horrible...If you want to be left with substantial charges on your card that werent supposed to be charged then spend the time you should be enjoying the Splendor of Vegas dealing with the bank then this is the place for you. Ask Tiffany the waitress this is what she did and didnt even notify the customer of the mistake until they found out later at another establishment..then spoke with Ryan and said theres nothing he can do yet it was a mistake from the establishment and the customer should not be burdened by their ineptness and uncaring attitude for their valued customers.  If I were you, Id run away...run run..Shame on you Holsteins and shame on you Cosmopolitan Hotel.

TLDR: originally 3 stars because of big issues with elevators and small issues with room, but customer service at the end brought it up to a 4.

My partner and I arrived on a Sunday, and were checking out on a Friday. We took a Lyft from McCarran and noted that the area for cars was a little small, but since it's a more contemporary hotel this is probably to minimize our environmental footprint. Since we arrived fairly early (around 12), we left our baggage with the bell desk, all of whom were quick, incredibly welcoming, and overall great. Afterwards, we headed to Wicked Spoon, then the front desk to check in and Andrea kindly assisted us. Originally we booked a terrace studio, but we mentioned we were on this trip for our anniversary and she provided a complimentary upgrade to a terrace suite facing the south part of the Strip.

My partner and I frequently travel, but we usually stay at modest Airbnbs. We booked our room with the expectation that it would be an experience to stay along the Strip. When we arrived, the room was wonderful and far more than we could have imagined. With its own living room, spacious closet, fridge and microwave, soaking tub (unfortunately with no jets), two sinks, sliding doors, comfortable bed, blackout curtains, and seating along the terrace, we were floored with how much was in it. The view on the terrace is not as gorgeous as the fountain view, but still certainly nice with a fun vantage point to watch events at the Marquee pool, etc. That being said, there were a few issues with the room: the toilet door kept getting jammed, one of the faucets in one of the sinks wouldn't turn at all, and the lights wouldn't turn off in the closet. The toilet door was taken care of as soon as it could be (thanks to David with Facilities!), and the front desk gave us a room credit as an apology, but it was still frustrating until fixed.

Housekeeping was incredibly respectful of our space, and when they came in while we had a do not disturb sign, they left a note and asked us to call the front if anything was needed. I appreciate that they only replace bed linens every third day because I respect conservation of resources. We were startled because one night our lights were on and balcony rearranged, but we came to the conclusion it was because they vacuumed. I would have liked a note, but that's ok. I did, however, call housekeeping for a comb and did not ever receive it. :(

The design of the hotel is sleek and very modern. There's a lot more open space here than older properties along the Strip, which I loved. The casino smells of cigarettes like most, but it's definitely not as bad as others. Slot machines are pretty modern, mostly electronic rather than manual. I do wish they offered you something besides $5 when you sign up for Identity (their rewards program), because another nearby hotel offers you either two free drinks or something else that I forgot.

The hotel consists of two towers, Chelsea and Boulevard. We stayed on the 25th floor of the Boulevard Tower. On the last few days of our trip the elevators only worked sporadically for the entire tower. My partner and I needed to leave by a certain time and literally no elevator passed our floor so I called Guest Services to inquire about the elevator situation. They apologized, said their technicians were fixing it, and offered us room credit and a phone call when it was done as compensation. Because of our time constraint, we had to walk down 25 flights of stairs, and I was in heels so I was not a happy camper. This kept happening throughout the last few days, to the point where we got in an elevator to go upstairs since we didn't know if it would come back down to our floor (it didn't, it reset). We hope they will resolve this permanently, but in the future I will request a room in the Chelsea Tower instead.

Check-out was initially disappointing. I shared some concerns with Diego, who did not seem to care and basically shooed us away after charging the card on file. I just felt like dollar signs rather than a valued guest. Frustrated, I later spoke with Alfredo at the Information desk, who brought me Valerie, the Director of Front Office. I shared my concerns (and also praise), and she handled the situation calmly, tactfully, and to my satisfaction. 

Some random cool things to note. The Chandelier bar is very interesting (different drinks on each floor) and all the lights are real. Secret Pizza, when you find it, is tasty. Summer Dive In movies at the Boulevard Pool are a fun activity, but if you're facing the south side of the Strip you can just watch from your balcony. There's a walkway outside that leads you to Planet Hollywood from the second floor.

To recap, the snafus with the toilet door, comb, elevator, and Diego brought this to 3; Andrea, David, Alfredo, and Valerie helped bring it back to a 4. I'm glad they made things right and I hope to encounter more staff like them whenever I return.

Nice room terrible service at check-in.   This must be a recurring issue since while I was waiting for 5 hours fir my room I heard from a dealer at the blackjack table, without even mentioning anything, that she could help make the experience at the front desk better.  All I asked her was to deal me good cards.   If they expect to be part of Ritz Carlton they better train the front desk staff to act like it.  Otherwise the rooms are very nice and the rest of the facility is great.

It's definitely a nice hotel, impressive in many ways.  The rooms are nice, brand new, and... they have a balcony - unbelievable for Vegas.  I travel a lot, and I am pretty spoiled when it comes to hotel so the rooms are nice but I am not as impressed as some other reviews.

Now the cons... the service is not all that great. Small details that irritated me.  I left my laundry bag on the bed like I would do anywhere else, but the room service didn't pick it up.  I tried to call the room service and the bell desk 3 times at 11pm and waited for over 3 minutes each time... no answer.  That's pretty bad for this type of hotel. The shampoo and conditioner bottle were not replaced, not even thrown away. Only one bottle of water in the room, but 20 bottles of booze.  As I said, little details that add up.

I swing by the Cosmo all the time whenever I'm in Vegas. This place is gorgeous, but the rooms are pricey. I usually come here for the music at the Boulevard Pool or the Marquee Day and Nightclub. Slot machines are alright... This place is definitely for the younger crowd. The Book & Stage is the place to be if you want to enjoy good, free music. I saw Mayer Hawthorne and Brandon Flowers here during the Cosmo's grand opening, and it was a wonderful experience.

Boyfriend and I came here in December of 2014. We loved how we were able to make s'mores. We loved the atmosphere. However, we didn't like how small the ice skating ring is and how many kids were around. But then again, we came during the day. They have different themes at night. 

We will come back again to try out the date night theme.

Alrighty, after reading a couple of similar reviews, I feel the need to warn people about the policy of this hotel. It's difficult to give only 1 star to what could easily be a five star hotel but because of their booking policy, I have to.
I booked with Expedia because I actually like dealing with them and you're guaranteed the room you book. I brought my entire family and I was staying for 5 days. We drove in late to avoid Saturday traffic. I had booked the one bedroom terrace suite overlooking the fountain. But when I got there, they had given my room to someone else and they gave me a handicapped studio on the other side of hotel ( not the Bellagio fountain). I had to move the next day to the room I had booked originally. Why?!!! What a stupid policy.
It completely ruined our whole evening and was a pain to have to unpack and pack up the next day. They downgraded our Saturday reservation! 
This is how they treat repeat customers who plan ahead. Wow! It was our anniversary. So instead of soaking in our tub as we watched the fountain,
I was crying into my cocktail and drank way too many. 
So my friends! It's a first come first serve, general admission hotel. Most of the people who work there are amazing and really sweet, I really appreciate all the people who tried to help me but one cannot makeup for a horrible booking policy or for ruining a couples anniversary.
I even prepaid.

I love this hotel.  The terrace suites have a great view of the belligo water fountains.
So many good restaurant all in one place.  The rooms are big but house keeping is not the best.  I like that the casino floor is not high we're u get lost easy,  the dealers are very helpful.

I live in Vegas and my father came to visit from the UK. He got an extremely good room rate when booking over there and in advance. The room was very large and fantastic for the price. Incredible views of the strip and I love the fact that the room came with a balcony. The bathroom was very modern and I like that a lot. We even got complementary breakfast the next day at the buffet. This made it an overall excellent experience. Even though I'm leaving Vegas I have to come back in a couple of months and I have already booked my room here. I wish I could remember the girl's name at the front desk as she was great. I definitely recommend the Cosmo!
Helena & Cherie were the best bartenders I've ever experienced. Knowledgeable and helpful with everything I needed 10\/10!

Good times. Rooms are cozy with a classy hard rock like feel. Fun decor. Gym has boxing lessons if you want and all the cool clubs and restaurants are here. Tons of people but it doesn't feel packed.

I had this at five stars until I found out that you get totally scammed by the bellman who have a racket with the limo drivers. Beware they hike the limo fees up by 20 bucks to you and collect it from the limo driver. Not much money but its the principle.

Cosmopolitan is a beautiful casino I love the balconies bars and restaurants the chandelier bar is gorgeous my only complaint is the restrooms they are SO DARK wish they had more lighting in the women's restrooms make it brighter. Also clean the toilet seats I've went into the same stall and it had the same dirty spots on the seat.

The Cosmopolitan is one of my favorite resorts in Vegas. It's trendy, beautiful and cool all at the same time. The chandeliers are over the top, but that's what makes this place unique. Their rooms are classy and clean. I love the separate bathtub, and the huge shower can fit a group of people if you're into that haha. Their in room balconies are unlike any other hotel with the best views of the strip and fountains. There are so many dining options, and the location on the strip is central to everything.

I went for a tony robins metting and we stay at the hotel it was really good ... The room is very big afortable and clean.... Great bathroom... The restaurant just incredible we eat at the mexican , hamburgers and  italian and was just great i do recommended

Great rooms. Restaurants and bars in this hotel are very good.

Although the Cosmopolitan has been open for nearly a year they just don't have it together yet. 

The lines to check in or out at chaotic. I was unable to get a final statement when leaving as the front desk was a mob seen. A trip to the front desk to get an extra key took 25 minutes.

There was no facility to print boarding passes or at least none that any of the employees knew about. We left an extra hour early and had our boarding passes printed at the airport. 

A cab driver told us they avoid the hotel of traffic congestion, making the line long and slow. 

There were times we waited 15 minutes or more for an elevator to squeeze into. Many would stop at absolute capacity. 

I am told this building was intended to be condos rather than a hotel. This may explain the difficult approach for the cabs and the seemingly insufficient number of elevators. Residents would likely not be coming and going as often as visitors. 
Thus would be a good place to stay on weekday but not during busy times.

Out suite had a washer and dryer, full kitchen great view and good view. I would stay here again if they fixed the front desk and added six more elevators in the West tower.
The review is for their cool bar and friendly staff.  Service was speedily and drinks were perfect  Great atmosphere too.

from the 22 untill the 27 I had the pleasure of staying at the cosmo a treat for my 50 birthday we had an amazing time the room,the service was all 5 stars the best meal came from stk service and atmosphere wonderful I was up on the 67 floor in a one bedroom terrace the hotel located right in the middle of the strip get a bus pass and take the duece any where allday up in down the strip. Now the only one downfall was when we checked in which went really quick they asked us for a 750 deposit that we get back we had already paid for the room so thought that was odd but with no charges to room you do get it back all except a 28 dollar aday fee but a wonderful experiece

This place is so amazing!! Definately will come back here! We spent the night here at a the Terrace one bedroom plus. I can't even describe how amazing it was. Very spacious with the japanese bathtub, view of the strip (that you could see while your in the bathtub as well) , huge balcony, nice design, and great service! The self parking here was so easy! before you enter the garage it would tell you how many are vacant, total of how many cars in each level, and the most AMAZING PART on top of each parking space there would be a red light on the roof right above it. If it is red its occupied, if its green its an open parking space. Makes my life so easy wow! No more driving all over the place to find a good parking. My only issue with the place I stayed that was that it was so hot, good thing its winter but the spacious room, comfortable beds, and everything that comes with it makes up for it.

This hotel has it all! 

Seriously , look no further than this hotel for views , casino , day\/ night clubs , and resturants. The location is ideal for walking around the strip and the rooms are just so luxurious.

Overall experience results in a two star experience, but that's being a bit generous....

Checked in to the hotel on Sunday 10\/19\/2014.  The line to check out was pretty long but there were about 10 attendants assisting customers so the wait time was about 20 minutes to see a clerk to check you in which should not be the case at a higher rated resort.  The front desk had me as checking into a 'City Room' while I booked a one bedroom suite with a terrace.  They reviewed my reservation again and requested evidence from me for which they accommodated my reservation.  They attempt to up-sell nicer rooms which I am okay with but others may find this as an annoyance. The attendant keeps guiding you through photos on a screen of different room types and floor plans in hopes of up-selling.  I'm still okay with that but they may want to reconsider this practice when there is a line of 90 people waiting to check in to their rooms.  

The room itself nice mainly because it was newish but lacked some finishing touches and doesn't seem too well thought out.  For example, the suites at the Aria have heated toilets, the ones in the cosmo have toilets.  The bathroom is open to the bedroom.  No, this is not a typo, the bathroom is actually open to the bedroom. 

To use the square tub, enough for two people to sit in but extremely short (aprox 3.5') but is not enough for even one person to lay in or use as a tub.  The design allows for sitting only and the tub has a window open to the bedroom.  No glass, no wall, just a tub that looks into your bedroom with a wooden dusty shade (which looks like it was purchased second hand from an Econo Lodge) that could be pulled down between the bathroom and bedroom. 

The Balcony and the view...  so the balcony glass is absolutely FILTHY, it has not been cleaned since probably the first month the resort opened for business.  The view was of a massive air conditioning vent even thought the suite views are advertised as City, Strip and Fountain.  I don't care about view very much but I'd prefer not to go onto my terrace and see a massive central air condenser.

When I first got to the hotel, there were literally SEVEN knocks on my door by hotel staff.  They claim they received calls to drop off a hair dryer (not me), they receive another call to clean the balcony (not me- oh, and they swept the floor of the balcony but the glass is still a disaster), another visit to fill the mini bar (not me), one more because someone reported a fuse being blown out (not me), One more dropping off towels (not me) and the other two I can't recall off hand.  

I called the front desk and asked where they "do not disturb" signs are kept and they said it should be right behind the door.  I asked them to deliver one and they said they would but I requested they stop knocking, just please hang the sign on my door because I have not requested a anything from the staff and am getting harassed by hotel staff. They followed my request.  Thank you cosmo, you followed my instructions. 

Checkout times.... They have checkout at 11:00 AM.  To the best of my knowledge most strip hotels offer a Noon checkout but are extremely courteous to their guests with regard to checking out late. Nope, not here at the cosmo.  They knocked at my door at 11:50 (Do not disturb sign posted, but the knock for checking out late I could understand).  I told them I was packing up and will be out in a few minutes.  About 20 minutes went by when I look over the bill on the TV screen and see excessive mini bar charges.  This isn't my first time at a hotel with a mini bar so I'm familiar with charges being applied if anything is moved.  I confirmed and accounted for about four items being used, and they had about 7 other items which were not used or touched, one of which was cashews, which they charged three times for on the same day.  your 14.00 cashews are still here great cosmo people.  They proceeded to let me know they would check to confirm the items are still here and if they were they would remove them from the bill.  I'm okay with that but anytime I've ever called down for a item at the mini bar not having been used, without question, the front desk apologizes and removes it from the bill. 

I thanked them for reviewing my minibar situation and asked if he wanted me to check out on the screen or he wanted to check me out.  He was like, well you know Mr F., it's already after 12:30, and there will be a late checkout fee added to your room.  I asked if he can remove that as a courtesy since I was unfamiliar with the fee. He said he could not, I asked what the fee was waived.  The front desk Manager had a smirk on his face, was extremely obnoxious and unpleasant.  His name was Caleb and I'm mind-boggled that this dude has a job.  You suck!
Hands down the best place you can stay at. I will say it's even a must. Sure there might be fancier places. But you can't feed off the energy this place turns out unlike the other hotels here.

Very nice hotel. I loved my room on the 40th + floor. I had a spacious room with a great view of Las Vegas. I could see a lot of the other hotels. The staff here was outstanding. Its very high end, walking though make you feel rich. Yes something about this place makes you feel good. Its also part of Marriott and I love Marriott. The only thing that I had a negative thing to say about this is the pools. Yes we went to all the pools. WAY TO SMALL. what where they thinking. Not enough places to set. Dont know how but this needs to get fixed.

I can only give this hotel 4 stars because I didn't stay here and didn't get the full Cosmopolitan experience. I can imagine that it's worth all 5 stars, but I can't know for sure just yet. I did however visit the casino a few times during the day and night. It's gorgeous inside with strands of crystals hanging from the ceiling like you are actually inside a chandelier. OMG I loved it, sooo pretty. The clubs and shops inside were top notch and most probably out of my price range, but awesome none the less. I went to the Sports Book and got to watch my team kick butt for a little while on their screen of TV's. I had bet at my casino, but The Cosmopolitan's odds were better. This place is pretty much one of the nicest hotels on the Strip right now. I walked through almost every single hotel, and this one really stood out!

Summary: 
-prostitutes
-trashy
-bad maintenance 
-dirty bathroom
-bad cleaning led to injury
-unreliable wifi 
-bad smell in room 
-no follow up when I expressed concerns

Detailed review:

The thing I noticed upon entering was the weird smell in the room. It smelled kind of like mildew and pot. I just left the door open to air the room out, but the smell ended up persisting for the whole stay. I also noticed that there was a huge wet spot on the carpet. I stepped in it and got my socks wet. It just seemed to be water so I let it go. I just thought the maid spilled water on the carpet. Little did I know, that nasty wet spot on the carpet would actually end up spreading and growing bigger throughout my stay. It seemed to be leakage from the air conditioning, so I think that was the source of the mildew smell. 

My room was also not cleaned well. This is absolutely unacceptable because I checked in later in the day, so their housekeeping had plenty of time to do a thorough job of cleaning up from the previous guest. The bathroom was sloppily cleaned. The sink vanity area had water spots all over the place and there were water spots all over the mirror. I do a much better job cleaning at home. The corners of the bathroom had piles of hair and dust from the previous occupants. 

The lack of attention to cleaning really showed in the shower. First of all, the handle to turn the water on in the shower was so loose that I could've easily pulled it off completely. This is something the maid should've noticed if they'd paid any attention while cleaning, which they clearly did not. Who would expect a new hotel to have some shoddy maintenance that their fixtures are already falling off? It turns out that this lack of attention to detail is DANGEROUS because my travel companion got a cut on their foot from a small glass shard that was in the shower. Not a good start to a trip in Vegas where you have to do a lot of walking. 

While I'm on the subject of the shower, you get a peekaboo style shower in your room. What this means is that if you don't close the blinds, everyone in the room gets to see you shower. The blinds roll down from the INSIDE of the room, not from within the shower. So if you piss off one of your travel companions, or they're big pranksters, that means they can roll up the blinds while you're showering...in which case I hope you've got a very fit body, waxed beforehand, and have an exhibitionist nature, or a swimsuit, because they'll see everything and you can't do a thing about it unless you step out of the shower to close the blinds. This feature sounds pretty sexy if you're traveling with your partner for a romantic weekend, but it's not ideal if you're traveling with family or friends. Even with the blinds rolled down, they'll see your silhouette anyways so you might as well put on a good show and shower seductively. Lol. I suggest you watch some Cinemax at night for ideas for posing. Ever think about how sexy you can look while washing shampoo out of your hair? Well you can test that out here. 

The resort fee is high and it covers wifi usage for your stay. I won't complain about high resort fees because that's pretty much standard I'm Vegas hotels now. What I will complain about however, is the unreliable internet connection. I had to wait a long time for pages to load and it cut in and out a lot. You can pay an extra fee for premium internet if you want. 

As far as the bedroom area is concerned, I was not impressed. It's got a lot of flashy design but it's nothing special as far as Vegas hotel rooms go. There are mirrors all over the place and artwork of female and male legs over the headboard of the beds. It's supposed to be sexy but it just reminded me of crime scene photos. The agenda of this hotel is pretty clear. If you look in the minibar area, you can buy a kit with condoms, lube, and mints from the minibar. 

On an elevator ride back up to my room one night, my elevator companions were two prostitutes accompanied by two clients. They were negotiating payment in the elevator. One John was so flustered that he forgot to get off the elevator with his lady. The door closed and she'd stepped out while he was stuck for another few floors. Talk about embarrassing. Lol. 

Fun fact: while prostitution is actually legal in Nevada, it's actually illegal in Clark County, which Las Vegas is a part of. It's one of those things that I think some hotels, such as this one, look the other way on. Do with that info as you wish. 

The overall impression I got was kind of trashy. Another thing that I saw in the hotel was a girl that was so drunk that she stumbled around, fell to the floor, and had to be escorted out by security in a wheelchair. Ever been so drunk that you need a wheelchair? It's like spring break up in here. 

For the price that I paid, I expected much more from this hotel. When I expressed my concerns to their "guest services specialist", I got no response. Very disappointing.

This is always my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas. Starting with the nice parking garage where the spaces are wide enough that you don't leave with door dings all over your car. From the moment you walk into the hotel\/casino, it doesn't smell like the typical Las Vegas hotel. It has a very fresh smell and well circulated air and you don't walk out smelling like cigarettes like all the other places. The overall appearance of the casino etc is awesome and the rooms I generally get have spectacular views and the rooms are very nice.

We decided to try this place after reading many good reviews about this place.  Although the presentation of the food was good.  It was definitely one of the worse buffet we had.  Both service and the food quality is simply unacceptable.  We entered the buffet at 5:30 PM on XMas Eve.  By 6:00 PM, most of the better food were completely gone.  And left with the pasta and cheap meat.  The roast beef\/prime rib was worse than the buffet you can find for $15\/person.  It has absolutely no taste.  They serve lamb, but they were serving lamb leg instead of rack of lamb.   We waited for 45 minutes for their soup noodles and it was never refilled.  The korean bbq short ribs were also gone by 6pm.  We had empty glasses of drinks and stacks of plate after an hour because we never seen our waiter.   There were like 12 different flavors of ice cream and 5 of them were out.  As for the fruit, they serve only 2 different kind of fruit which are pear and banana.  We talked with the manager about it, he agree that the service was unacceptable but never get back to us.  As for the crab legs, they were cheap small crab legs.  The buffet was definitely not worth $45.

Chelsea ballroom for Super Bowl Party !

Never again!!!!

How is it that everyone that got tickets to attend the Super Bowl Party at the Chelsea ballroom and about 100 people left standing.  There were not enough tables and chairs for the guests. It was ridiculous!!  It was so unorganized!!  

I had to put two chairs together side by side and three of us sit together, of course the other end girl and myself get to share it with only half of our cheeks.  My husband had to stand during the 1st half of the game.  The other guy went back up to the room and watch the game, my bro in law went out to game at a table, one girl went up to the room and took a nap.  Thats how 7 of us got seating at the end.  And we snatched from other tables too.  Pathetic.!!

The food selection was very minimal!!  One small circle and that's it.  No pizza, shrimp cocktails, Haagen dazs ice cream, buffalo wings ran out, No vegetarian food for veggie friend. I could go on... but I'm tired.   I guess we were spoiled by Caesers Palace Super Bowl.  

Good Game though.  I'm a Denver fan so I didn't really care who wins.  Although we cheered on Baltimore because half of our friends put their bet on Ravens 1st half and 49ers 2nd half.

I was here for a conference, so I can't speak on behalf of the hotel itself, but the place is massive and easy to get lost in. The workers there are courteous, so I guess you're getting the excellent service that you pay for.

I love this hotel for the elegant excitement it exudes (how's that for alliteration?).  I haven't stayed here yet, but maybe one of these days they'll give us a comp.  Hope springs eternal...

Tonight we attended our second Identity Series cardholders' free event.  This was a "tasting" at the Wicked Spoon, their buffet.  Private room, all you can drink of the two specialty drinks that were available:  one was an apple and vodka concoction, and the other was a ginger beer and vodka.  Both were terrific, and I didn't get the name of either drink.  But before I could even get to Drink #2, I no longer cared  :D

The food was buffet-style, and tonight's offering was Polish Cuisine (as in Poland - you didn't have to shine anything).  They had the a dish akin to stuffed cabbage, only the little meatballs were mixed with shredded cabbage, rather than stuffed into cabbage leaves.  I'll have to remember this - it's much less work to prepare!  It was delicious.  There were also fresh green beans that had a major kick; beautiful yellow beets and purple cauliflower that were pickled, but much too tangy for my taste.  And there was also hot borscht, served in little glasses with or without sour cream.

Waiters passed trays of breaded pork filet "fingers" that were outstanding, and superb pirogies.

The desserts were to die for - upscale pastries and mousses that for once tasted as good as they looked, and white or dark chocolate-covered marshmallow lollipops.  

My group of seven was lucky to snare one of the four round banquettes that were available.  Others had to stand at tables, and this event, which was supposed to be two hours long, actually lasted quite a bit longer.

This was a fantastic event,  and FREE!!! - and if Cosmopolitan continues to offer this kind of perk to cardholders, it will be a death knell to other casinos.  

The ambience throughout the hotel is phenomenal.  My major quibble is that the casino does not have enough machines to pique the interest of us low-rollers.  Too many of the penny machines have outrageously high minimum bids, and they just turn me off.  If I wanted to blow $3 and up for each pull, I'd play dollar machines.  But I don't.  So I don't gamble any more money at Cosmopolitan, I just spend less time there.

I have to give big kudos to George, one of the security staff.  When I first got to the hotel tonight I sat down at a slot machine to search my purse for my Identity Card.  I couldn't find it easily, so I pulled everything out.  Midway through the Wicked Spoon event, I realized my iPhone was gone, and took the long hike back to that slot machine.  The machine was right next to an escalator which, because it wasn't working, had George in front of it directing people.  He was still there when I went back and, praise whatever deity you worship, he had my phone!!!  Of course, the major thank you has to go to the honest person who turned it in to him, but that identity will never be known.  

The phone caper was the icing on the cake for an evening that was perfectly executed and beyond classy.  I love this hotel!!!

Third time I have stayed at The Cosmo and the last two stays have been great. The service was exceptional, particularly from Michaela in their guest services team.I have stayed in the Wraparound suites on each occasion and would definitely recommend it. Plenty of room, could easily fit upto 6 or 7 people in this room and the balcony is hUge (in warmer months you could actually have a couple of people sleep out on the balcony). Speak to guest services or pay the extra $ on the website for the view of the Bellagio fountains, it's well worth it! 

The food at The Wicked Spoon is great although $40+ is a bit steep but if you can get breakfast included with your room then it's well worth it. The pool area isn't huge (compared to say, The Aria) but is a cool place to hang out with good views of the strip.

I did used to stay at The Aria and whilst I wouldn't complain if I had to stay at The Aria again (another great hotel), The Cosmo has now become my residence of preference whenever I'm in Vegas. It's the kind of place Johnny Drama would stay and that's good enough for me.

Don't let the sleezy-day-club-Marquee people scare you upon entry if you are checking in on a Saturday- this hotel is great. Our room was FABULOUS and top notch. Balcony you can chill on- Check! (where do you get this in Vegas- basically no where-can you say debts+booze=Jumper?) Suite upgrade-Check! Won in the casino-Check! Great restaurants (Jaleo and Chino Pablano)-Check!, hip and gorgeous decor-Check! (and PS. I am soooo over the looks of Venetian, Wynn, Ceasers, etc- so done with old world sexy).

Love the room amenities- but hate that the fridge is not empty- we like to stock our own- so my tip... load that great deep kitchen sink with ice and throw your champagne bottles or six packs (however you roll-hey- it's THE Vegas) in there.

Check in was easy and quick- the quickest I have ever seen and we checked in on Saturday of Labor Day weekend. The pool you ask? Lovely and felt clean unlike at the day club at Marquee.Cosmo has access to lots of fun shopping and other great casinos, clubs, etc.

Unrelated review note: Most epic moment?: Seeing a nomad-like 70 year old woman in all pink and glitter sitting in the hot smoldering sun with a karaoke machine and singing Lana Del Ray's "Summertime Sadness" better than Lana Del Ray
One of the newest hotel and casinos on the strip. The lobby is very impressive with several multidimensional video columns with constantly changing content. The rooms are beautiful and modern.

This hotel is the best hotel I've stayed at on the strip, all thanks to my friend who has a bazillion Marriott Reward points (they have a partnership and you should take advantage of it if you can).  I've been able to stay here twice, once in a "regular" room and one in a junior suite.

The hotel is stunning. The service is great, and there are a variety of restaurants from your standard Vegas hotel diner, the best buffet on the strip, and the secret pizza place (3rd floor, go down the hall that has the record covers). I haven't had a chance to try out some of the other restaurants but they always seemed to have a decent crowd.

The rooms have tons of amenities. BTW, don't touch anything on the minibar, even if you pick something up and set it back they'll charge you (do not know from experience, but have heard from others). The last time I went there was 4 of us sharing a jr. suite, and it is definitely meant for a couple. Luckily there are blinds to shut the 4 windows into the tub and shower or else we would have had to really get to know each other during our stay. 

Our balcony faced the Bellagio so it was just gorgeous looking out onto the fountain and strip.

The boulevard pool is awesome. We rented a day bed and were super glad we did, because the pool gets packed. The service is great and we definitely ate and drank our minimum easy. Great crowd and music and you don't feel like you don't fit in.

I'm grateful for my friend but I definitely will pony up the funds to stay here again.

One of my favorite hotels in Vegas. This review is for my three day stay in October. The only complaints I have: the rooms doors are heavy. Like really really heavy; which is for safety I presume but oh man I was leaving to get some ice.. (which I later found out that the ice machines were not working on any floor) and the door swung back so quick, my nail on my middle finger got squished. It hurt for weeks! 

Other than that, the food at Wicked Spoon is delicious. Beautiful views and hotel upkeep is wonderful. The casino is one that can keep you there the whole day..... :)

If you are a 45 year old woman who knows what Sex And The City character you are, or still have princess pillow cases, you will love this place!   If you are a bachlorette party, hoping to run into other bachlorette parties, I can almost guaranty your success.  If you are not a bachlorette party or a self described cougar, go anywhere else.

I love this hotel. Decor is beautiful and atmosphere is great. I will always be staying at this hotel when I return to Vegas. The beds were so comfortable, staff was always great and helpful. The bathroom was very neat with a see through shower. The pools were amazing! I would recomend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vegas for a great time!

Never will stay again! Had the worst 3 nights in Vegas ever, nothing in the room worked and the staff couldnt have cared less. From the lights, tub, door, TV, phone, the maid service that didnt come,  NOTHING worked and it took at least 2 calls per issue to get something done! Beautiful place but it does not work and the staff couldnt give a shit! It even took 2 calls when I got home to get a manager who just did the "what can I do for you" bs like comp my room, I'm never going to stay there again!

This hotel is fabulous, great crowd, hot rooms, and not all the typical Vegas Riff Raff.

You will pay for everything, internet coffee etc, but keep an eye out for specials. We got a $150 resort credit for booking a 3rd night.

This lovely and relatively new hotel & resort in Las Vegas is first rate! Vinny and I stayed there this summer during a quick jaunt to Vegas and really enjoyed the hotel and all of its amenities. When we first checked in, we didn't expect we'd have a good experience because right off the bat we had to wait in a 45-minute line to check in, and then, the hotel screwed up and didn't have our reservation correct. Fortunately, the folks at the Cosmopolitan more than made up for it by giving us an updated room free of charge-- and, I must say, the room was amazing!! It was a large 1 bedroom suite w\/ a balcony overlooking the Bellagio hotel and fountain (yes, the very one where they do the daily fountain and light show-- what a view, I tell ya)! Plus the room had a large sunken tub and walk-in shower, a large living room seating area, and high-tech work space (yep, sadly, I had to do a little work on the trip even though we were mostly there for vacation, but the work space turned out to be a godsend for me). 

Other great features of the Cosmopolitan include their casino (it's modern looking and packed with lots of high rollers and beautiful people), their abundance of restaurants and shops, and their large pool recreation area, which features a couple of outdoor bars and plenty of lounge chairs for relaxing. 

Note that one of my favorite things about the Cosmopolitan, believe it or  not, is their Pizza restaurant. Check out my review of the Pizzeria @ The Cosmopolitan. Some of the best pizza I've ever had!!

This is what Vegas is supposed to represent!  Cool, hip and sexy!  My room was rather large, with a bathroom that looked into the bedroom!  Each room had a spacious balcony.  No Bibles or Book of Mormon instead they were replaced by art books and I had one of a Chinese Kama Sutra.  The mini-bar was responsible and there was even a can that contained condoms and other sensual delights (for $20 of course).  The hotel has numerous clever "Do Not Disturb" signs including one with 2 ladies in a very sexy pose.  

The art is incredible.  They have old cigarette vending machines throughout that are filled with various trinkets that you can purchase for $5 dollars.  I saw 2 very large high heeled shoes for a great photo op.  The lobby is amazing with screens everywhere allowing a quick change of appearance from an elevator shaft, to a library.

The eating areas were adequate.  I loved Eggslut!  (fantastic name)!  There is also another restaurant called Secret Pizza.  There is no mention of it in the signage as it is truly a secret (a cab driver told me about it on the way out).  

The casino area was good.  The table limits were mid- to upscale (rush times, craps tables had $15-$50 minimum bets).  There are 2 separate high-limit rooms.

The only downside was the check-in.  I arrived on a Sunday which I know was the worst day and I waited for 40 minutes.  Not sure if that is part of the mystique like waiting in line for a popular club.  There is some type of relationship between Marriott and the Cosmo and I wasn't sure what that was.  Marriott traditionally has never allowed gambling in any of its US properties.  Cosmo has its only rewards program that is separate from Marriott however I believe the points are transferable.  

This is without a doubt my favorite hotel.  Very surprising at every turn.  Kind of like a non-scary American Horror Story set (based off the LA Hotel season with Lady Gaga).

Beautiful Hotel, but bad service.  

Seems like they are still working out the kinks here.  

The rooms are amazing!  Balcony terrace which I've never seen in Vegas and a beautiful view overlooking the bellagio fountain was great!   

Sub zero refrigerator dishawasher stove and washer dryer (just no utensils, cookware, or a coffee maker) - so if you want the room to cook in just be prepared to bring your own.  

Where things went downhill for us was that my brother was with me along with his wife.  Unfortunately they were on the east tower.  They were here from Florida.  DO NOT STAY IN THE EAST TOWER!  Unless you don't mind loud music until 2:00 in the morning.   

After enough complaining the hotel told my brother that they would move him to the west tower while we were out during the day.  By the time we returned at 5:00, not only did they not move him, but when we went to the front desk he was told there was no room available despite being told he would have one.  Exhausted, and lacking sleep they finally got himin a room but made him wait two hours for his bags keeping him from getting in a nap. 

In addition when we arrived on friday July 15th my brother had arranged for a welcome basket for us.  Unfortunately it was delivered to the wrong room.  I think around 8:00 or so that evening it finally showed up.  Oh well. 

My other gripe is that we wanted to go to peepshow.  Should have just gone to planet Hollywood to buy them.  We were told VIP was sold out but we would be right behind the VIP section.  If you call the back of the theater behind VIP then technically we were behind it.  

When we contacted the concierge they wouldn't do anything.  I've never experienced a hotel so disinterested in customer service.  

Today we ordered a large pot of coffee with extra cream.  $20.00 later including a $5.00 delivery charge  (no problem with that along with the included tip) we have coffee with milk.  How hard is it to get coffee right.  

My take on this place as a late 40's male with my late 30's wife is that this hotel is catering to the 20-30 crowd that doesn't mind $20+ cover charges $20 drinks and blaring techno.  I'm now too old for that so clearly I'm not that demo.  I want luxury. I don't mind paying for it.  

Maybe in a year or so this place will be great!  The property is run by deutche bank not MGM or ceasars or a regular casino operator so maybe over time it will be better.  I've stayed at dozens of Vegas hotels, and this place really is a nice property - great fit & finish with the rooms    I possibly had the random bad experience.  It happens but the way they treated my brother who unfortunately was stuck on the east tower makes me leery to stay here again out of fear that I might get a room on that side and never get sleep. 

So to sum it up.  

Great looking hotel
Poor customer service 
Geared towards a younger crowd 

If you can tolerate that you'll have a great time.

This hotel is amazing!! I've stayed here a couple of times, and love the rooms and location. My favorite part is that the rooms have a balcony, and if you're lucky, you get a room facing the Bellagio fountains!! The view is beautiful during the day and at night!

The only thing is that I feel like all the rooms are centered around the shower. It's designed for a couple, cause the showers are very open and have windows that look into the bedroom or the balcony. It makes sharing a room with friends a little difficult lol. And the bathroom doors don't lock, just FYI. 

And check out Secret Pizza and Holsteins while you're there!

O_O

WOW. 

Chic. Classy. Stunning. Glitz. Glamour. Upscale. Sexy. Do ya need more adjectives?!

This hotel is by far the nicest new kid on the block. The Bellagio has a special place in my heart as does the Wynn, but I feel like this hotel is more for the younger crowd. 

Be DRESSED TO IMPRESS. Because you will stick out like a sore thumb if you don't! Everyone else (females) are in cute dresses, decked out in jewlery, high stilleto's with hair and makeup did... men are in their collar shirts, slacks, dress shoes, hair did too!... 

EYE CANDY - everywhere! Chandeliers hanging everywhere and it's just amazing to see... so FLASHY! HELL even the BATHROOM is NICE! 

Nice huge floor full of gaming options... shops... various dining options... pool... and Marquee (hella packed!!!)... 

Definitely a choice to stay at on my future Vegas trip... if the Bellagio or Wynn doesn't reel me back in lol...

The crowd is youngER... (30's ish)... and everywhere you walk there are crowds of fine lookin people hanging out... I guess this is the newest hot spot on the strip! Kudos to you Cosmo! :)

Take notice Vegas, this is how a hotel is supposed to be. I have only been absent from this place for 3 days now but I am so ready to head back. I stayed here for 5 nights and 4 days and enjoyed every minute of it. We arrived here on at Thursday afternoon and were originally dismayed when they said our rooms were not ready and that we would have to wait. This isn't exactly the thing you want to hear after traveling 2000+ miles but the situation was quickly corrected after our check in lady talked to management. Not only did they get us room upgrades but they were able to get me and my friend rooms on the same floor. Score!! Ronnie our check in lady was also gave us the lowdown on the hotel and told us the best places to eat and shop. First and foremost everything in this place is absolutely stunning (of course its new but its much more than just that). No expense was spared in design or materials. Jesus, they even hired a world famous graffiti artist to spray paint the walls in the parking garage. 

The room was tastefully decorated, comfortable, and spacious. They have kitchenettes which include microwave, fridge (stocked with ultra expensive goodies but still enough room to store some private items), coffee maker, and a sink. They also have a dishwasher and not sure what you would need that for even though one of my lascivious friends told me that sometimes people stick their sexy toys in there. The room has a freaky vibe since anyone in the Japanese soaking tub could be seen from the bedroom due to carefully placed window. The also have a window in the bedroom that opens up to view the shower. The lesson here is to not take any of your horny friends to the Cosmo (they also have a pleasure kit in the room which probably costs $50 and includes some intimate items that could make your night a good one). Ok this sex stuff caused me to digress. The bathroom is very large with nice toiletries.  The closet is also huge. The bed was very comfortable but the pillows weren't firm enough. Other high points:

Bars\/Lounges - the place to be right now in Las Vegas. The crowds tend to be younger and the bartenders here are exquisitely skilled. Every drink I ordered was fantastic. They also don't hold back on the alcohol. Visited The Chandelier a few times and Bond. Didn't make it to Marquee since Benny Benassi and Kaskade were there the weekend I was there and I didn't feel like fighting the crowds. The Chandelier is a nice place to people watch as they pass by all ho'ed up to go to Marquee. 

Restaurants - Tons of great places to get food here. We visited Holsteins, The Wicked Spoon, and Pizzeria. The more expensive joints are on the 3rd floor and we didn't make it here even though we had planned too. If you look at all the ratings collectively for the Cosmopolitan restaurants I dare you to find another hotel on the Strip that beats them currently. This place knows how to do good food.

Casino - Small as compared to others on the Strip. Limited selection of machines but everyone playing the tables seemed to be having a good time. Don't go to Cosmopolitan if gambling is your sole reason to stay at a hotel. 

Conference Rooms - I actually attended a conference here and it was one of the best conference centers I have been in. The AV was top notch. We had catered breakfast from the hotel each morning which was fantastic. Beautiful interior. Can't wait until they offer another conference here.

The Cosmopolitan clearly has a "anti-ugly" hiring policy. Everyone that works there is gorgeous. Hell even the maid staff seems to look like one of the first few contestants knocked off America's Next Top Model. I had to do a double take because I thought the bartender one night was Alexander Skarsgrd. The staff there were also wired with blue tooth headsets. We called down for toilet paper one night and had it there in 3 minutes. Sydney Bristow couldn't have been that fast. These people don't play when it comes to communication or customer service.

FREE WIFI!! Take note other Vegas hotels. It's fast as hell too.

A few gripes. The pool area is very small. Definitely not equipped to handle the amount of rooms they have. Our room was on the 21st floor of the East Tower but we could clearly hear club beats all night. Had we not been so tired at the end of each day this could have put a serious crimp in my sleep schedule. 

I am absolutely in love with this place and will be back. Can't miss if you are planning a trip to Vegas.

Beautiful rooms in a modern 'glamour' decor hotel.  Overall smaller classy casino in a prime location on the strip.  This was my first time straying from Mandalay and Mirage (my "Go To" spots to lay poolside).  

The suites were really a good deal and a great meet-up "home base" place if you have a group of pple hanging out over the weekend.  We stayed in a terrace suite, requesting a room w\/ a pool view.  

My impression of the rooms:
- I love all the interior design touches: interesting coffee table books to browse, artsy book ends and candy dishes, cool desk w\/ slide out...
- all suites, love the terrace view - perfect for hanging and seeing what's going on at the pools.  Want some of the pool club ambiance?  Just open your sliding door.
- great, comfy L-shaped couches
- However, one thing I was really disappointed in for such a new hotel:
POOR housekeeping.   :(   The shower drain still had hair from the previous guest (Ewww!!).

The pool areas overall were smaller than I thought:
- The Boulevard was a good hangout.  Smaller than I expected, but nice view of the strip.  Couple pools in this area.
- The Bamboo was less busy, more low key and the lap swimming pool.  Fake palm trees.  BOOO.   Oh, and where was the bamboo???
- never got around to the club... :( 
- pool restrooms weren't very nice :(
- seemed like the main attraction of the pools were the (2) in pool showers.  This probably would've been more entertaining and relaxing if they were always running, more like a waterfall.  As they are, the times when they were running were few and far between...  kind of boring.

The hotel layout was minorly annoying (true of most casinos)... not very much food\/beverage choices w\/in easy access of the pool areas so you inevitably had to go down an elevator to get something to eat\/drink (pool bar\/restaurant times don't coincide w\/ pool hours).    Maybe a way to lure you back into the casino area...  ;)

The casino was definitely smaller than I expected, thus also lacked some of the energy and excitement that comes along w\/ busy larger casino play.  

Would I go back?  For the room: Definitely.  Great hang out.
For the poolside fun: nope.  It's just not on par.

A solid 4 star Hotel.Only reason it is not 5 star is for the gaming portion.The hotel is new and has all the bells and whistles.When I checked in I was told to come back around 2 pm to get my room(no big deal) which I did.I was upgraded to a wrap around suite that was awesome.This thing could sleep 10 easily.The best part was the patio.One side was a view of the strip and the other was the bellagio and water show...The hotel has several nice bars and lounges with a very nice sports type bar on the main drag in the hotel.There were several food options on the 2nd floor which we tried but nothing that really stood out.The pools were great also.There are 3 so regardless of your mood you can find one that will work for you.The gaming was so so and after 2 nights of loosing went across the street to PH and won my money back.Much different vibe at PH also.More fun and lively.I hung out there for the balance of my stay and had a blast.

Beautiful Hotel but... Front desk staff were kind except for an Asian gentleman who checked me in. I don't remember his name, but his ma nner was not friendly. More 'matter of fact ' attitude when I was trying to explain that my company had paid mine and myvcowrkers room . 
He would not check and insisted I place my card for taxes and resort fees and other costs. Finally he did check but asked for my personal card anyway. Either way, it's his attitude that did not sit well with me. 
The hotel however is really chic and beautiful
2013 American Culinary Federation National Convention. Amazing hotel!!!!

I cannot say enough about this amazing hotel. Everything from the dcor to the night life is simply superb. I must say, a major plus about this hotel is the view of the strip. I believe almost every room has a balcony, which was fantastic. 

Upon our arrival we upgraded our room. Totally worth it as it was out of this world. The bathroom was extremely spacious with his and her sinks + we even had an additional bathroom near the front door by the kitchen. The TV did everything from ordering room service to check out. The telephone also controlled climate, lighting, etc., how cool is that? 

Enough about the room... I couldn't stop taking photos of the awesome contemporary dcor and digi boards. Apparently the digital boards are award-winning - they were gorgeous, definitely something you'll have to check out in person if you are ever in Vegas. You see them mostly in the main lobby and inside the elevators. 

As for customer service and the casino definitely 4+ star in my book. VIP guest services took great care of us Saturday night when we ventured to Marquee nightclub. This is a must! Most amazing venue - if only we were there for Kaskade (dj). We were there celebrating a birthday and Marquee made it a night we won't ever forget. 

Oh, if you want a late night bite find the secret pizza place in Cosmo. Delish.

Gambling 101 at the cosmo

Ask member services about their lose 100 get 100 credit back. Basically my gf and I gambled all day and had fun. We didn't win overall but for $30 bucks we got entertainment for the whole day, free drinks, and a free buffet. This place ROCKS. Plus they have this awesome little cell phone cleaner that takes advantage of technology that the rest of the world seems to negate lol.

Revision..... First timers dream but then it gets old and it becomes just another overpriced tourist trap on the strip

I am a gold member of Marriott [recently a Platinum member as well] and have stayed at Cosmopolitan before on multiple occasions. Yes, we all know it's a beautiful hotel, I cannot deny that. I was originally going to give them 1 star for the terrible customer service we were given this past weekend, I am truly disappointed in how they treat their Gold Members here; however I will mention that they have made efforts in trying to fix the problem, hence now the 2 stars. If you're going to treat me just like a normal guest, what is the incentive for me to keep staying here? I waited the whole weekend not to write this review and thought that I would feel better after the weekend, but no, I am still pissed off at their customer service. 

Let me start out by saying a group of 9 girls are here for a Bachelorette party. We booked Qty 2, double queen Terrace Suite rooms. We arrived at 9:30am in the morning, knowing check in is at 3pm, but hoping the rooms would be available in the morning anyway so that we can prep 1 of the rooms for the Bride-to-be's arrival. No rooms were available. They even had the reservations incorrect, as the system said that I had only booked 1-king bed room, and another double queen bed room. [We had booked this many months prior to our arrival] When I showed them my confirmation email, they had acknowledged that they had it wrong in the system and will change it to reflect the correct rooms. They also told me check-out is at 11am so most likely there wasn't going to be any rooms available until at least check-out when they could clean some rooms for us. I had mentioned that we would prefer to have adjoining rooms however understood that it can't be guaranteed, but we at least wanted the rooms to be on the same floor for convenience. Ok...so we left to do other things but continued to keep checking in throughout the day. Nothing was available, not even at 3pm, which is the regular check-in time. NOT EVEN 1 ROOM. Really? You're telling me, that check out was at 11am. And that not even 1 room had checked out, and was cleaned by 3pm?? We had been waiting around at the Vesper bar where the waitress had walked past us probably at least 20 times and noticed we had been there practically the whole day. When she asked the situation, she must've felt bad for us, and told us that when we finally do check into our room, to let her know what the room number it is, so that she can send up some champagne for the inconvenience and for it also being a Bachelorette party.  [Fast Forward: When we finally were able to check into the room, we did give her the room number...and guess what....no champagne ever came - great intention but don't promise something you can't keep!] By 330pm I had had enough, and complained about how we have been waiting around [for what felt like forever] and please just to find us 1 room so we can get checked in and relaxed. They said they were able to get us 1 room (it wasn't going to be adjoining rooms - but by that time, that was fine) So excited to get into our 1 room while we continued to wait for our 2nd room to be available. We get in....and it's a 1-King Size bed room, for 9 girls. Lovely, just lovely. We finally called on the phone and asked to speak with a manager to get us into a double queen room, in which she [I think Emily] kept saying that there was no other rooms available at the moment and that she WASNT EVEN SURE if there will be one available for us TODAY at all. They even tried to tell us that we could use the Sleeper Pull Out Sofa in the meantime.... OK 1 king size bed and 1 sleeper pull-out [which was uncomfortable as hell] FOR 9 GIRLS?! Really? I can't even believe this was suggested. Finally, after being put on hold multiple times and them trying to find the 2nd room for us, they came with this solution: We would stay in that current 1 king size bed room, and they got another double queen room for us (for that night) and the next day, they would look for 2 double queen bed rooms for us but it wasn't guaranteed that it would be on the same floor. I was so pissed, but exhausted from this whole experience, we just had to take what was available. It was upsetting and embarrassing [for the bride to be - her first time really getting to enjoy a vegas trip and it started horribly] They offered a $100 food\/drink credit to be used inside their hotel which was useless to us. 

The next day, they were able to get us the 2 double queen rooms we were looking for, not adjoining rooms but on the same floor - which was fine. They sent us up some chocolates and a hand written note, that was a nice gesture but could never make up for the experience. This also doesn't make up for booking for Qty 2 double queen rooms and having to pay that same price but getting only 1 king bed on the first night [they should have credited the bill proportionate to the 1 king size room for that room for that night to keep a repeat customer] Sad to say, that I can never ever stay here again.

Probably the only hotel we will stay when we come to Vegas again! The room is really nice and super clean ! Especially the fountain view from the room that  nothing can beat ! All the staffs were very friendly! Although the hotel's pool caught on fire the day before we went, we still got to enjoy the pool during our trip! Can't wait to go back there again!

Stopped by for a little staycation. The cosmopolitan is definitely one of my favorite hotels on the strip. Here's why...

PROS:
+ If the main lobby is busy, they'll open a second registration desk on the 4th floor to check-in. Total check-in time was about 15 minutes from the time I stepped foot in the main lobby to the time I had the keys in hand and headed up to my room.
+ Balconies, balconies, balconies! Great views of the strip, especially if you're facing the Bellagio or Planet Hollywood. We got stuck facing Aria and it still wasn't a bad view.
+ Free wifi
+ No resort fee
+ Standard room (terrace studio) is spacious and well designed
+ Large, spacious shower
+ Staff was very nice
+ Plenty of parking
+ Easy to get in and out of the casino from Harmon Ave
+ Decent room rates w\/ my Marriott hook up ($130 for a Sunday night)
+ Heated pool on 14th floor by the spa
+ Free lounge act at the Book and Stage (def. not your typical old school Vegas lounge)
+ Good places to chill and drink and people watch -- Bond and Chandelier

CONS:
- Several random hairs in the tub and around the bathroom
- Open bottle of wine in the fridge from previous guest
- Decent water pressure from the shower, but not great

4.5 Stars

I stayed here for five days during a professional conference, so I can say with some assurance that the place itself is fine. however, in general, the hotel staff are pretty wet behind the ears........the concierge(s) didn't know anything about where my conference was being held (mind you, it was in their hotel!) I was charged for having the mini bar cleared for my own items, etc etc. The only employee who was actually helpful and knowledgeable was a young man named Ali D. who worked the front desk.

I chose to stay at this hotel because I loved the location and the decor. While I am all for themed rooms, elegant + luxurious rooms, sometimes a girl just wants something modern. 

I stayed in the one bedroom terrance suite (610 sq feet) and it was spacious and clean. OHHH I forgot which tower I stayed in, I think the east tower and there was construction going on outside. Starts at 9am, very loud. Check to make sure you're on the opposite side of that. I checked in 3 hours prior to normal check-in time and they had rooms available. I know it depends on the weekend but it's always worth a try to get in earlier. 

The room had a freezer (no refrigerator?? am I blind? I seriously could not find it.), a microwave, a sturdy office desk with lots of tech plugins, and lots of artsy books as decor. Minor wear throughout the room. 

I would think this room could comfortable fit 2 on the bed and at least 4 people on the floor. 

Bathroom: 

CO Bigelow shampoo, conditioner, body wash, + mouth wash. Glass separating the shower and bedroom area but there are curtains you can pull down. Japanese soaking tub with a beautiful strip of the view. (A Japanese soaking tub is a square tub that's pretty deep, you sit in it rather than lie down). However, there is no glass separating this area so if you're gonna get naked, your friends get to see you naked! 

Bed: 

Clean sheets, mattress is on the softer side, and a plethora of pillows. 

Terrace: 

Has one lounge chair with a stool so you could technically sit two. There's also a table so I guess someone could sit on that too. 

Free Valet, but self-parking is faster. Fast Check-In. There is gaming and it is a smoking casino but great ventilation and it smelled pretty good. 

5 Minute walk to Bellagio, close to Mandarin Oriental

The smartest layout and design of a hotel on the Strip.  Unlike most hotels where you have to go through the casino to get to check-in, you have a more quiet and civil check-in area at the Cosmo.  And the conference area is separate, too.  It gives it a boutique feeling that way.  Cut to our room...Terrace Studio was HUGE.  Separate toilet and shower, big sitting area, large outdoor balcony, comfortable beds with a down comforter.  Nice amenities although a few times housekeeping forgot to replenish our towels despite us leaving them in a pile on the floor.
